text: Very good. Its very tart and tastes like raspberries. I like it a lot. Very good.

Bottle thanks to Mr. Priest. Red / amber, beige head. Straight berry nose - raspberry tart. Flavor is straight crushed raspberries, more off color fruits, fruit leather, apricot, mango sweet tarts. Very very sweet with very light mild acidity and effervescence. Lovely

Bottle. Raspberry brown sugar woody aroma. Sweet raspberry brown sugar with tart ripe sweet raspberries and fruity sweet woody finish. Medium light soft slick body. Very good. Better than Wisconsin Red IMHO. ..................................................  [Fuck A-B/Inbev]

Pours clear mahogany with flat tan head. Aroma of raspberries, wild strawberries, light red grapes and bretta, hints of almond icing. Taste is rich berry sweet with a mild tarty finish, very balanced. Light and crisp body with average carbonation.

Thanks Virby44 for the bottle! Poured into a snifter showing very dark wine red with half a finger of tanned cherry foam. 

The nose shows a lot of juicy and ripe raspberry with hints of steel tank. 

The palate is light bodied and lightly carbonated. A lot of juicy raspberry with a very subtle tartness and a moderate sweetness but completely balances with the beer. Finish is once again more raspberry. Very light malt profile revealed on the end. Drinks similar to juice and could use a bit more tartness but still refreshing and juicy.

01-24-2008

Appearance: Crimson red body looking almost liked pureed raspberries with a thin head.

Smell: All rapsberries here, aroma of freshly picked berries, looking good.

Taste: A rush of raspberries hits you, tart & bitter but no apparent sweetness maybe masked by the tartness.

Mouthfeel: Fizziness in the mouthfeel, bold & heavy taste, a little too heavy maybe. Dominant flavor is raspberries (of course!) which have a over-ripened feel to them.

750 ml bottle. (Festival Foods) La Crosse, WI.
Deep ruby red color with a tiny white head.
Intense raspberry aroma with sweetness, mild sourness and some maltiness. 
The flavor is intense raspberry... with sweetness, blackberries, mild tartness and some maltiness.
Tastes like fresh raspberries, It really could not get more authentic. Its Fantastic if you like fruit beer. its basically a wine tho lol.

I had to have a few of these to make sure I got the rating right, or maybe these are just way too tasty. Poured from the bottle a bright ruby red. Aroma is unmistakably raspberry. Taste is like fresh, sweet, mashed up berries. Absolutely delicious.
Bottle purchased at the brewery. Shared with the wife. Pours ruby with a light pink head. Aroma was raspberry, wine. Taste was tart, tangy, raspberry, raspberry juice.

One of New Glarus best known fruit beers, at B.U.M.B. in Antwerp. Lacing, off-white, moussy, stable head, warm and practically clear copper reddish colour with orangey hue. Aroma strongly reminiscent of (home made) raspberry jam, ripe fresh redcurrant, vanilla, Roosvicee or even rosehip tea, some caramel, almond. Sugary raspberry jam dominates the flavor, with a thin and shy redcurrant- or rhubarb-like acidity buried underneath, medium carbo, soft bready and caramelly core but the sweet raspberry flavor persists till deep into the finish, sugary and even a bit cloying, but the acidity still lurks from below and keeps it tolerable. The result of this, as with the other sweet New Glarus fruit beers, is a genuine, artisanal dessert-like sweetness, which I experience as being very different from many industrial sweet beers here in Western Europe (mainly Belgium). Some of these Belgian sweet fruit beers, including the Lindemans lambics which served as an example for New Glarus back in the nineties, attain a similar character of non-industrial yet still heavy sugariness leaving room for actual fruit (juice) flavors; New Glarus essentially translated this concept from lambic to the (then) new American sour ale style and can be seen as a kind of modern craft beer-era tribute to the old Lindemans or (at least previously) even Timmermans fruit beers. Whether you like very sweet fruit beers or not, there is no denying that New Glarus is one of the breweries worldwide that has raised this concept to its maximum in terms of honesty and quality.
At Hopishop 2016. Aroma of raspberry jam and mild tart. Taste has sweet raspberry jam, candy and no tart. This is really sweet stuff, drinkable, but not very complex or interesting.

750 ml. bottle sampled @ HopisHop B.U.M.B. 2016. Deep red amber. Nose is pure sweet raspberry jam, sweet & sugar heavy down to the point of almost seeming a bit artificial. Their Belgian Red reminded me of Lindemans Kriek & this one reminds me of Lindemans Framboise but this one isnt as good, sparkling taste, extreme & very sweet raspberry jam, pure sugar, candy, almost artificial sweet, far too sweet for its own good, not sure if I could drink a lot of it. Fizzy raspberry jam & sugar body. Crazily sweet but good since I do like raspberry jam after all. I still think that it is funny that beer geeks look down on the sweet Lindemans beers but worship these candy New Glarus beers.

Fresh bottle shared with friends. Pours beautiful dark red with a pinkish head. Aroma is huge berries, cherries, somewhat funky. Flavour is mild tartness and quite a bit of fruity sweetness. Lots of raspberries. Moderate body, a lot of flavour. Feels like a stronger beer with all that flavour. Very quaffable, fresh and fruity. Light carbonation. Really nice!
Süß säuerlicher Antrunk, Marmelade, zunehmende Süße. Viskos, intensiv, Himbeeren. Schwierig, mir insgesamt zu süß - trotz Essigstich. 10/9/8/8/10/9

Bottle from Clint (starcross) -- cheers! Ive never had a beer like this. Forget the name, theres nothing tart or sour about this beer. Instead, it somehow manages to taste like an alcoholic bowl of fresh raspberries. Theres a ton of strong, authentic fruit flavor in the bottle, and the beer itself is an incredible reddish-purple color. I served it for dessert at Thanksgiving, and everyone from my twenty-something cousins up to my 85 year old grandmother loved it.

Intense raspberries, dry grain malts, creamy, straw. Slightly hazy, reddish amber, small, off-white head. Medium sweet and sour. Overripe raspberries, sweet, yet dry fruit, raspberry syrup, light tart, soft carbonation, medium bodied. Beautiful Fruit Beer, intense and yet complex throughout. Keg at Sugar Maple, Milwaukee.

Pours a cloudy burgundy. Cherry raspberry aroma kinda mild compared to the Belgian cherry I had yesterday. Mineral. Hints of leather and a bit of spice, kinda oddly some slight funky beef jerky/soy sauce. Some mild woodiness. Taste is a raspberry cherry with some mild dry mild wood with some vanilla. Certainly quenching and flavorful, good for summer. Not too tart. Fairly balanced with a tart finish.

Bottle courtesy of maniac and oh so grateful. Smells like a mixed bouquet of raspberries and vanilla blossom. Honestly better than any perfume. Not actually that tart. Sweet and smooth. Hard to believe its a beer. Frothy pink head. Minimal aftertaste except a bit of cream or honey. So freaking good.

Pours dark red with a large light pink head that fades to a frothy cap and leaves behind great lacing. AROMA: raspberry, raspberry, raspberry and raspberry!!!! Cough syrup, raspberry pie and concentrated gelatin. TASTE: get some!!! AFTER TASTE: youll never know! This is fan-fucking-tastic!!
Wow, this beer does not disappoint, perfectly balanced with the smell of fresh raspberries on a hot summer day.

Pours a dark red color with a nice head that dissipates rather quickly. Aroma is of cherries,, raspberries, figs, acetic acid, and honey. Tastes of sugar immediately followed by tart raspberries and sour cherries. Super smooth and very palatable. Awesome beer!

750 ml wax-dipped bottle courtesy of Homers FBW contest. Aroma is overripe raspberries, vinegar. Pours a murky rust-like hue with a collapsing bone-white head. Taste is pureed raspberries (both flesh and seeds of the fruit screaming with flavor), tart and sweet as raspberries tend to be. As good of a fruit beer as one can imagine outside of lambics.

Another beer Id never have the pleasure of trying without John Erb, who never seems to leave his home state of Wisconsin before considering his friends beer hobby. Aroma: The raspberry character is at once candied and tart; theres some lighter, but healthy level of dark chocolate as well. Appearance: Slightly hazy chocolate raspberry pour with soft carbonation holding up an off-pink head that settles into a thin ring. Flavor: Candied raspberry and chocolate with tartness more subtle initially; candied elements and chocolate back off to give the light tartness a boost; the tartness continues on through the lingering finish. Palate: Medium body, sticky texture, soft carbonation, lingering finish. Overall: After having Serendipity and Belgian Red, the novelty of these NG fruit beers has worn off a bit. That said, this is still stellar stuff, and one Id definitely recommend without reservation.

Ruby red pour with a huge two finger, pink head. Lace present. Aroma is strong with raspberries. There is a slight tartness as well. Taste is full of raspberry. Not too tart, but not too sweet either. Hints of raspberry syrup, like on a sundae. Medium bodied. Very refreshing.

Im not sure how ive never rated this, but this is and always has been one of my favourite fruit beers, ever, since right when I turned twenty-one! Deep dark red coloured body with a ruby tinted head that fades relatively fast. Bright aroma of tart raspberries, icing sugar, sour grapes, blackberries, strawberries, very light malt and many more raspberries and sugar. Medium-bodied; Super pungent raspberry flavour with a bright fruit note, some subdued grain and earthy maltiness, but the sugars really come out, along with the bright raspberry notes. Aftertaste shows a very nice, refined raspberry flavour, some sourness from the yeast and a little earthy maltiness, but the pervasive (in a good way) raspberry cant be missed. Overall, a very nice beer that is elegant in almost every way, but very sweet as well, with a bright tartness near the end. A great beer that should be at sampled at every turn, even if you live in Wisconsin and can find this regularly, but especially if you are from out of state and dont have access to this on a daily basis. I sampled this 75 cL bottle purchased from Festival Foods (De Pere) in Green Bay, Wisconsin on 29-July-2012 for US$8,99 sampled at home on my youngest daughters first birthday party, on 30-January-2016 at home in Washington, after purchasing this before my first daughter was ever born!

Nose is grassy with an off flavor. (more like a sour than a fruit beer). Taste is off flavor then sugar then ends with a nice raspberry flavor. Nice head that last okay. Mouth feel is amazing. Lower rating than other beers by them.

Purple to ruby pour with half inch of pinkish white head. Aroma of raspberry cream and grainy lager. Softer carbonation, light tart mouthfeel, very clean finish that curls the tongue. Big raspberry flavor, Apple, perfect tart and sweet, grain bill makes great rounded presence.
From a bottle into a glass. The pour is a cloudy ruby with a white head. The beer has a raspberry taste that is really sweet with a sour ending.

Bottle sample at a tasting. Thanks Becca. Clear read amber with a nice head. Aroma of candies, berries, strawberries, yeast. Very sweet with some tartness, flavors of raspberries, yeast, quite sugary. Light-medium bodied with sticky mouthfeel.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Dancing Camel, Tel Aviv. Thanks to who. Nice red with pinkish head. The aroma has lots of raspberry, strawberry, sweetish, somewhat sugary. The flavor is juicy, very sweet raspberry, a bit artificial, sugary with notes of strawberry, candy and jam. Lively carbonation, light to medium-bodied. A bit too sweet.

At a tasting, thanks, smallish bubbly head, hazy lightish red color, aroma of fresh raspberries and bubblegum, raspberry flavor, quite sweet but with enough dourness to balanc. Simple but fresh and quite enjpyable.
Aroma of raspberry, taste is raspberry, very fresh, well balanced, sour finish, taste buds gone!
Jam, hoppy, tart, woody, sweet, bite, effervescent, smooth, amber - a great, tart dessert ale

Bottled shared at dbarnolds, 10/31/15. Reddish-pink colored beer with a pinkish head. The aroma and flavor are tart, fruity and a little funk, with a pretty strong sweetness as well. Mostly raspberry. Really nicely balanced and flavorful fruit beer.
Sour&bitter. Reddish brown of color with a reddish beige head. An aroma of raspberries, weak acetone, red berries and metallic. A flavor of sweets, black berries, sweets, weak sour, fruity and sugar.

Tasted from bottle. Pours a dark ruby red with slight pink tinged head. Aroma of fresh raspberries. Taste is moderate to heavily sweet with a nice tartness to balance it. Flavor is plentiful raspberries. Very well done fruit beer. Definitely one of if not the best fruit beers I've ever had. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Like crack this. Well, smells of raspberries of course. Hint of vanilla. Very smooth, slightly sweet, but not too much. Nice complex maltiness under the fruits. Just enough acidity to keep it from being a wine cooler. I always say I dont like framboise, but this might make me try a few more. Simply excellent.

Where: Neighbor brought back a variety from a trip home to Wisconsin, forever grateful. 
How: 750 ml bottle, shared at a neighborhood tasting.
Appearance: Deep red in color with a hint of brown, small head.
Aroma: Raspberry and vanilla, like a raspberry dessert.
Taste: Perfect mixture of sweet, jammy raspberry and tart, fresh raspberry character. 
Palate: Carbonation is medium high, wonderful raspberry flavor long after your last sip.
Overall: Spectacular.

Hazy burnt amber, thin ringed head. Nose is rich billowing raspberry and lean grassy brightness. Initial taste is rich upfront tart, fading seedy berry. Soft carbonation and itchy tart mouthfeel. Finishes lean creamy raspberry, obvious, heavy sweetness. Id be keen for more time with this. Cheers BnnnahhhhhhEhhjj
Bottle thanks to Mike. Dark red with off white head. Aroma of raspberries sho nuff. Taste is straight up raspberries. Dry and tart, acidic.

Bottle at the 1st Annual Christmas at The Garvies tasting 2015. Thanks to BenH! Pours clear red with a thin white head. Aromas of big raspberry, light sour. Taste is raspberry juice, light sour finish. Lovely balance.
Bottle at craigs. Pours deep amber, nose is tart raspberry, toffee, taste is sweet, sugary raspberry.

From notes. Enjoyed at the Great Taste of the Midwest on August 08. The pour is a deep ruby with a thin light pink head and no to lacing as it falls down to a film. The aroma is incredibly sweet raspberries. Its like a jam, almost to a point of being slightly off-putting. I was hoping for a little more of a tartness than the sweet bomb here. Its still good, but doesnt play into what the name suggests. The flavor is great. Lots of raspberry lots of syrup, and even a little bit of jam. The tartness comes through a little on the back end, but again, I was hoping for a little more. The mouth feel is thicker and jammy, with a soft carbonation lingeringly great fruity sweet finish. This is really good, but a little more tart on it, and it couldve been amazing.
Huge raspberry aroma, sour and tart. Very crisp and drinkable fantastic raspberries and a hint of cider taste.
Also very good. Really good rasberry flavor. Nice noise and good flavor. Good night of drinking.

15/VIII/15 - 75cl bottle @ Were drinking all of Richs American beers tasting - BB: n/a (2015-1083) Thanks to omgrich for sharing the bottle!
Clear copper red brown beer, small irregular beige head, little stable, non adhesive. Aroma: very weird, sweet, bit sugary, lots of raspberry candy, sickening sweet aroma, raspberry flavoured yoghurt. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: very sweet and sugary, raspberry jam, bit acidic, tart touch, little lemony. Aftertaste: bit metallic, raspberry candy, lemony, sugary, meh.

At Richs Massive Cellar Emptying Tasting. Raspberry tart with a medicine mixed with raspberry jam. A berry jam light brown. Light spritzy body and dry finish. Very very sweet and jammy raspberry. Alright but too sweet.

Have had this before...surprised I havent rated it. This is a mix of current pour and memory. Glowing red with some brown and moderate lacing. Recall loads of raspberry jam and dried raspberry...this latest has a distinct burnt marshmallow streak, but only I got it so maybe Im crazy. Taste follows...recall raspberry jam, and dry tart raspberries...this latest has mostly burnt marshmallow over indistinct fruit.
Had this at sugar maple in wisconsin with the fam..nice genuine raspberry taste..delicious
My second favorite of the tart beers. This one pours a reddish pink color. Aroma is all fruit berries. Taste is pretty much raspberry juice. Some tartness, but not overwhelming.

Bottle. Clear, deep reddish-amber pour with a dissipating head. Aroma is very sweet raspberry, strawberry candy, vanilla. Flavour is likewise quite sweet, butt tastes naturally so. Delicious raspberry, very lightly tart, hints of strawberry and wheat. Probably the best fruit beer I've tried.

UPDATED: AUG 10, 2015 Sample at Great Taste of the Midwest. Aroma is raspberry syrup, a lot like KRE. Some malt, mostly raspberry. Appearance is red, off white head. Taste is raspberry, crisp, preserves. Mouthfeel is crisp, like raspberry soda. Overall, this is unbelievable.

courtesy of Jérôme Rebetez - quite clear reddish beer with a poor head retention; strong aroma of raspberries jelly, a bit bubblegum-like; light herbal; full-bodied, some sourness quickly overwhelmed by a huge sweetness; light fizzy and with lot of residual sweetness and tons of raspberries notes in the finish; faint sourness - well-crafted yet clearly far too sweet
Clear blood red. Very floral raspberry nose. Tart and wine like with enormous raspberry character. Great finish.

Pours dark copper red with a small head. The nose has lots of raspberries and a hint of oak, vanilla and caramel. The taste is very oud bruin and much less tart than expected. I would go as far as saying, this isnt tart at all. The flavour is super rich and there is clearly lots of fruit but Im missing an acidic kick in the end for me to go into the 4s.. This reminded me a bit of earthmonk with added raspberries. Not a bad thing.. Mouthfeel is alive with soft carb. Aftertaste is lingering and sticky sweet.

Bottle shared at the Cotteridge convention, 24/01/2015. Many thanks to Leighton. REddy / caramel coloured pour with a sticky lasting off white head. Aroma is sharp raspberry, woody pips, sweet. Flavour is composed of syrupy sweet, raspberry tart, fruit, very sweet cough syrup. Nice fruit character but too sweet for my tastes. Palate is sugary sweet.

Bomber share. Aroma is raspberry jam. Appearance is a red-brown with a little head. Taste is tart raspberry. Palate is sour and sweet. Overall, a really good beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle pour split, picked up for me by a friend in Wisconsin. Dark raspberry pour, sweet raspberry aroma, taste of raspberry Juice, I think this beer is centered around raspberry. Hmm make sense. jocking aside this is a really good beer very low ABV, really does just taste like a really good juice, happy to try this one.

750 mL waxed bottle poured. Thanks Tcon for sharing this one. Big one off my list. Pours a dark reddish color with a super sweet raspberry juice aroma. Cherry, raspberry, cranberry juice like flavor. Not nearly as tart as I expected. Very juicy and easy drinking. Kind of a late cranberry tartness I suppose. Very nicely done.

Bottle split with my boyz. Lol. Pours hazy dark reddish orange-brown-lots of colours in a big mashup. Medium offwhite head. Aroma is jammy as fuck, slightly sugary, raspberries. Taste is jammy aswell, obviously, sweet aspberries, some tart raspberries and some sweet subtle orange-like juice. Refreshing.

Bottle thanks to klimaet. Pours a reddish amber with a big, off white head. Aroma has jaaaaaam! Raspberry jam, sweet berries, tart fruit and lots of fruit sugar. Taste is sweet and tart, slightly oxidiced raspberry. Very jammy and juicy. High carb and juicy body.
Raspberry and cherry like with champagne. Fresh fruit all way through the highly carbonated fruit brew. Amazing how the fresh fruit taste.

750ml bottle. Appearance: Deep burgundy and clear, with a moderate pink/brown foam head. 
Aroma: Fresh raspberries and blackberries. No noticeable malt or hop aromas. 
Taste: Sweet raspberry up front, giving way to a sharp, tart, acidic bite. A slight malt breadiness is there after the swallow. 
Mouthfeel: Medium bodied with high carbonation that accentuates the tartness of the beer. 
Finish: Lingering tart raspberry/blackberry with a hint of bready malt. 
Overall: World class fruit beer. Perfect balance of fresh berry aromas, and contrasting sweet/tart berry flavors. Well carbonated to accentuate the tartness. Great dessert beer

Nice ruby color; Medium body; Aroma of sweet malt, yeast, rich tart berries, & fruit; Flavor of sweet malt, yeast, fruit (rich rasberries), and some oak; Finish is dry & tart; Very nicely balanced; So good!

Draft. Dark ruby color with thin pink head and minimal lacing. Intense raspberry fruit aroma. Raspberry flavor is overpowering; no traditional beer flavor. Syrupy consistency. Sweet finish. Overall, a very good, flavorful beverage

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Raspberry and cherry fun. All over room these wonderful aromas. Flavor is equally as good, fresh Wisonsin fruits. Nice lively co2 nothing to dislike about this unless you dont like the flavor on bottle. Perfect!

Bottle:Thanks, Corey. Murky velvet & crimson shade of red with a slowly receding, brown & fuchsia tinted head. Mild lacing. Looks like wine with foam. Aroma is a swift kick of raspberry juice to the face. Maybe a hint of grassy zest, but really its just 100% pure fucken raspberries. Mostly sweet with a faintly tart zip on the back-end. Flavor is just the same. Freshly pressed raspberry purée. Delicate with a candy-like fruit sweetness underneath. A touch of that seedy skin tartness helps for balance & keeps this from getting overly sweet. Such fresh raspberry flavor. No medicinal off tones. Really just a lovely & well-done fruit beer from New Glarus, yet again. Macerated raspberry love sauce.

An after dinner palate cleanser, maybe. My wife enjoyed it. This just doesn't fit in to my must have list.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
this is not quite a beer and not quite a wine. it does have a strong fruitiness about it as you can imagine from the name. a little too sweet for my tastes.

Bottle from beerman6686 as part of the big boy swap set up by macboost. Nose is super fruity and sugar. Poured deep, deep red with a medium off white head. Taste is pure raspberry fruit juice with a light tartness. Hard to pick out any particular beer characteristics in this, but dang if doesnt drink good.

Bottle share at Cotteridge Wines. Thanks to Leighton. Hazy orange brown, small ring of white head. Aroma is light with some raspberry as expected. Body is medium, smooth, low carbonation. Taste is sweet and syrupy, light raspberry, tangy and tart. Lives up to its name then. Doesnt have the complexity of the Belgian Red.

Pours a deep ruby red with a large white head. I found the aroma to be quite weak but the resemblance was of raspberries. Taste is quite sweet raspberry forward, with a little tartness in the finish. Full bodied.

The aroma blends lots of raspberries, a light oak note, and a small hint of dough yeast. The beer pours a very clear red with a slightly pink head that is initially large but fades to a small ring that stays on throughout. The taste is mildly sour and slightly sweet with an intense initial flavor and with a very light raspberry finish. The palate fuses a slick texture, lively carbonation, and a light body.
Bottle at Cotteridge wine convention; hazy dark brown pour with a big bubbly off white head, raspberry aroma, taste has tart raspberry, dried fruit, sweet jam, excellent.

Bottle share. Cotteridge Beano. Hazy, dark red. Film of white head. Big raspberry. Cherry tart, or more specifically a Bakewell tart. Taste is light tart, and plenty of sweet, although its not cloying or hard work. Nice.

Bottle at Cotteridge Convention 2015. Ive long fancied this beer, ever since my early days on RB. Something about the name made it sound delicious. Upon sampling in found it to be a lovely framboise - the type that got me interested in beer all those years ago. Murk, sweet jam. This is dedicated to maeib.

Bottle split at the Cotteridge Convention, thanks to Leighton, 24/01/14.
Murky reddish amber with a decent crimson/beige covering.
Nose is raspberry syrup, tarte red berries, spice, sweet licks.
Taste comprises more raspberry syrup, sweet berry redux, light cherry notes.
Medium body, fine carbonation, semi drying close with sweet licks.
Another solid fruit beer but 4+!?
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 750ml bottle. Pours hazy orange red with a small head. Aroma is strawberry jam. Taste is sweet and jammy. Strawberry and raspberry. Lightly tart.

Bottle into tulip glass. Pours a reddish dark amber with a very fine, off-white head that quickly dissipates. Aroma is of sweet raspberries, raspberry juice. This is a sweet beer, though not cloying. Tastes of ripe raspberries, the tartness is buried by the sweetness. Substantial body, a bit syrupy; soft, fine carbonation.
Bottle via unknown. Pours a luminous reddish-pink, not much head. Aroma fruity, some lacto, white sugar. Body lively but sickly sweet-sour. Really? This is sweet to the point of being gross.

750 mL bottle poured into a Belgian tulip. Overripe raspberries come through in abundance. As it mellows, the aroma becomes more raspberry pie with some cranberry notes and just a light dampness that dissappears into background. It pours a unique, clear, sparkling cranberry color with a pink foamy head that retains a medium thin ring and leaves a splotchy, light, runny lace. The taste is highly sweet with a medium high sour, a light bitter, and maybe even a bit salty, too. The beer is thin, yet oily, and a bit sticky as it warms. The carbonation is bubbly and fizzy. The light body contains notes raspberries throughout the drink (so much raspberry). It finishes crisp with raspberries, a little bit of pie crust, and grass at the finish. Its highly astringent with notes of light grass lingering with berries (raspberry cherry). A very tart, decently refreshing drink.

Sampled at an ESBLS tasting. It poured a dark red color with an off-white head. The aroma was of tart raspberries and some funk. The taste was of raspberries with some tartness and hints of funk. Mighty tasty.
Thanks to P and K. Quite good. Sweeter than I expected and thicker but good level of tartness and big berry flavor. Serving: Bottle

750 ml bottle pours a clear brownish red with small dissapating head and very little lacing. Aroma is all raspberries with perhaps a touch of wheat. Taste is sweet with a tart finish, Body is medium with lively carbonation. Another great dessert beer to be shared with friends.

Smell. Amazing. Taste. Better. Simply amazing in all aspects. New glarus did well

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from bottle to glass. Brownish redish hue with white head that dissipated. Aroma is raspberry, sugar, slight lactic. Mouthfeel is great with a medium body and zesty carbonation. Taste is sweet throughout with a slight tart following. Overall this is a sweet beer but nice to share with others.
750ml bottle, wax top. Pours dark ruby brown with minimal head. Strong sweet raspberry smell and flavor. Slightly tart but sweet smooth finish. Another awesome fruit beer from New Glarus!!
Bottle. Pours hazy brown with small off white head. Nose and taste is sweet raspberry. Brown sugar sweetness.
750ml bottle pours a dark red color with a bit of frothy head. Tart at first, but smooths out very quickly. Incredible depth of fresh raspberry flavor.

Poured from bottle into tulip. Muted aroma that didn't offer much. Luckily the flavor came through in a big way. Great balance of sweet and tart, great mouthfeel, and easy drinking. It doesn't even taste like alcohol. You could give this to a kid. Don't, though.
Pours reddish with purple hues. Lots of tart raspberry aroma with hint of wood. Raspberry flavor, tart with some oak. Fantastic beer! Thanks to richlikebeer.
Bottle. Hazy dark amber with spongy pinkish- beige head, raspberry aroma, sweet and sour raspberry taste, smooth and thick body, long tart finish. Delicious but does not feel like beer.

Draft at the Cajun Cafe beer festival. Poured into small snifters. Brilliant reddish purple color with a pinkish fluffy head. The aroma is raspberries galore with a slight tartness and oak barrel. The taste is amazing with serious raspberries, blackberries, and a tartness. It is rather sweet which is the only downside but who cares. It is a delicious fruit beer with some tartness and dryness at the finish. Very very good.

Bottle @ ZZT X, small sample, thanks all for sharing! Cloudy ruby color, short head. Aroma is very fruity of raspberry, slight tart, some marzipan, mashed apples. Lot sweeter than I expected in taste, slight tartness only. Decent beer.
Bottle @ ZZTX. Aroma is huge raspberry, other red fruits, light malt note, some artificial sweetness. Flavour is candy, red fruits, raspberry artifical sweetener. Nice, but I dont get the hype.
Bottle @ ZZT 10 shared by Kermis. Amber colour with a very minimal off-white head. Smells sweet, syruppy. Tastes sweet, raspberry, syruppy, apricot jam. Medium to full body, soft carbo.

Bottle @ ZZT X, courtesey of kermis. Pours a clear dark purple beer with a small off white, pinkish head on top. Aroma of raspberries, red fruits, light oak. Flavor is quite sweet, little tartness detected.Loads of sweetners in there. Aftertaste is very sweet as well. Not really getting the tartness here but still very very nice!
Bottle @zzt10 shared by kermis. Brown red color with a small head. Smells and tastes sweet, raspberry, cherries, ranja.

Bottle @ ZZT X shared by kermis. Hazy reddish color, small off-white head. Aroma is lightly sourish, red fruit, lemonade. Taste sourish and sweetish red fruits, syropy. Hard to describe. Not bad but not really my thing.

Bottle shared at ZZT 10. Pours hazy red with an off white head. Aroma of raspberries and sweet red fruit, a touch of apple. Flavour is moderate sweet and acidic. Medium bodied with light carbonation. Decent, but too much sweetness.

Waxed bottle at the RateBeer DC Tasting. Reddish color with off-white head. Aromas of raspberries, berries, sweet vanilla. Tastes of big juicy raspberries, berries, tart notes. Medium body with a dry finish. Fantastic.

I thought Id had good raspberry beers before. Apparently I havent. Near perfectly executed. Ruby pour with good head and lacing. Light touch of bitterness from the raspberry seeds. Tart and sweet. Wonderful. Bottle.

Poured from a bottle at a bottle share in DC. It is a red raspberry red color with a slight head. The aroma is raspberry and the taste is a sweet fresh picked berry flavor that has both a sweet and sour taste
Bottle pour. Rich, tawny red in glass. Small, creamy head. Jammy nose. Tart, yet buttery flavors. Slightly syrupy on the palate. Well executed.
Pours deep burgandy. Tan head. Aroma not that nice: must overpowers the fruit smell. Great tasting start to finish. Complex tart sweet fruity slightly hoppy. Excellent!

75cl, no mention of ABV, exclusive American brew, with raspberries, thx alot to Eric for bringing this over!, complex fruit brew, fruity/sour and slightly sweet/woody, yet not too heavy, balanced, cloudy, good head, good brew

September 12, 2014. Bottle. Pours deep red with a pink head. Aroma is lots of sweet and tart wild raspberries and very light oak and citrus notes in the background. Taste is sweet and tart fresh squeezed raspberry juice up front, finishes of with a refreshing and slightly more tartness than sweetness. Medium smooth bodied, soft cabonation.

Poured from 22oz bottle at home. Super cloudy pink and red color with white foamy head. Mixed feelings on it at first but really grew to like it at the end. Very raspberry and tarty as expected - but it isn't an annoying fruit taste. The beer behind the raspberry is fantastic.

750ml bottle poured into champagne flutes. Dark red opaque body with a finger of red-brown head. Aroma is fresh raspberries, raspberry coulis, tart raspberry. Taste is briefly tart then a rush of sweetness comes in. Some light grainy maltiness on the swallow. Light body, thicker silky texture that is nicely offset by the spritzy carbonation, sweet finish.

"(disclaimer-this is a rating for a 2+ year old bottle-will rerate when i get my hands on a fresher one). poured a redish-purple with pink head. aroma is huge doses of fresh raspberries...after 2 years, really? taste is also raspberry and not much else, but the tartness seems to have subsided a bit, and its almost overly sweet, with the tart only making its presence known at the back of the mouth right before the swallow. A little oxidation perhaps brings the carbonation too high, which takes away from the feel and the overall impression of the beer, but its still quite good, and the sweet tart aspect lingers after youre done. Cant wait to try a new one. re-rate 4/30/09 got a fresh one-thanks pfoxyjohn. aroma and flavor is cleaner and incredibly fresh. no oxidation makes for better mouthfeel. great beer...from 4 (2 yr old) to 4.5 for a fresh one."

750 ml at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki, courtesy of AntonFred. Hazy red color with pink head. Aroma is raspberries, cherry and wood. Taste is very sweet, and the same as the aroma with raspberries and some wood. Medium body, oily, soft carbonation.

Bottle to glass. Pours a murky amber brownish color with a pinkish hue and a thin off white pinkish head. Aroma is sweet, apple cider, hint of berries. Flavor is delicious, mildly tart, huge pallet raspberry sweetness. Lingering tart and sweet, with a hint of Apple cider. Very tasty.

Bottle. Aroma is full of fruit. Taste is initially fruity then you can taste the tart! Pastry, light butter sweetness, then at the end its a little tart (ho ho). Lightly spritzy. Really easy drinking. Great stuff.

Another delightful fruit beer from New Glarus. Copper brown color. Heavy sweet raspberry aroma. Raspberry jam, some wheat, and tart profile. Beer is perfectly sweet, not cloying but very authentic fruit. Lovely effervescent mouthfeel. Fruit beer masters!

Pours a cloudy copper/brown with a small head and good lacing. Aroma of raspberry and wheat
Taste is raspberry preserves, sweet with some tartness and also some wheat. Finishes with some sweetness and a little tartness. Mouthfeel is semi creamy with a medium body and crisp carbonation. Excellent beer that would be great with dessert.

2014 bottle. Muddy brown/red color. Aroma is musty and lots of raspberry. Taste is raspberry jam up front with a nice sweetness. Gives way to a nice, round tartness. Full, thick mouthfeel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A muddy brown with ruby color, little head. Smells like raspberry jam on toast, slight tart/sour smell. Taste is very sweet raspberry jam taste and then tartness washes over the middle for a moment, some vanilla, and a faint hop in the distance, with some wheat like tones to finish with much more fruity sweetness. Dessert in a bottle, well done. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours an extremely cloudy dark red almost mahogany. Nose is so sweet and fruity. Tastes like raspberry jam. Super sweet, tart as hell, a touch bitter.  Really good.

Pours a murky purple red from the bottle with dissipating off-white head that leaves moderate lace. Aroma is big on the raspberries with a hint of metallic tartness. Taste follows, no metallic here, just big on the berry sweetness. Not sure this is as good as everyone says, would much rather have a Belgian sour any day.

Raspberry tart is so true, Full huge Raspberry aroma permuating everywhere. Unreal tart real tart flavor, but needed to match the huge fruitiness. So Balanced for all such big characteristics. Unbeliveable. If you get a chance to try this DO SO!!!!

From notes. From bottle share in October 2013 (courtesy of Mike Upson). Pours brownish with major red highlights and a half finger of tan foam. AROMA of earthy semi-tart raspberries, wheat malt, and a little bit of mustiness. FLAVOR of absolutely exquisite raspberries (nicely sweet, nicely tart)...not much else in the flavor department but very delicious. Semi-tart finish. The spritzy carbonation adds to the whole experience. Glad to finally try this...not particularly complex but wonderfully executed and delicious. (1167, 898)

Smells like intense raspberries. Perfect medium soda like carbonation. Taste is both sweet and tart raspberries. Mild funk notes occasionally, mostly at the beginning of the bottle (maybe wild yeasts at the top?). Notes of bread and pie crust on the finish. Aftertaste is about 10 seconds and the same.

(retrieved from 08/2013 Midwest jpg backlog, CHI tasting - 75cl bottle courtesy of CHI tasting crew, thx). Pours gorgeously deep pink, little bubbly soap head. Earthy-fruity aroma of defrosted, slowly thawing raspberries, a delicate tartness that is all berry and no sour beer. Watery palate, the dried? hops are not really creating enough of a dry mouthfeel for me here. Some nice vanilla from the cask. An excellent showcasing of gorgeously fresh and fleshy raspberries in a very fruity and refreshing drink, but far from an artwork in terms of sour beer brewing/blending - this lacks a Framboise lambieks complexity and depth. - Have to go with diabels older but still valid Belgocentric evaluation here.

Bottle pour. Pours a deep, deep ruby red with a pink laced healthy head. The moment you open this bottle the raspberry scent wafts across. The taste lives up to the nose here - somehow the tartness does not overpower the sweetness here or vice versa. I get no sour feel here - this is a pure dessert beer. Somehow the mouthfeel and lasting taste here give the sense that you have been drinking a squeezed/pressed bagful of freshly picked raspberries.

Strong raspberry aroma, with a hint of oak. Pours a clear dark red, with a large off white head. Much sweeter then most of the framboise I enjoy, but this does have a nice raspberry flavor, with a quick tart finish. This may work well as a way to transition people off of Lindemans and onto the sour framboises.

Brownish magenta in color... Aroma of fresh raspberry jam, syrup... Flavor is intensely sweet raspberry jam up front, funk and blue cheese notes come through on the palate, fairly tart finish... Oak, vanilla... Really nice, but definitely not for everyone 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bit of a reddish brown color. Big beautiful raspberry aroma, some slightly funky smell here too that I didnt really get from the other fruit beers by then. Taste is a fantastic raspberry jam, some sour, but actually less tart than I had expected. I could drink this every day.

I got this in Wisconsin. Pours reddish with off white head. Taste sweet, rasberry, fruity. I thought this was good. I would drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours amber with an off white head. Rich sweet raspberry, sweet malts, faint acidity, and a long fruity rich finish. Damn good.

Pours a fairly murky dark amber color with tan head. Huge fruity nose, tons of raspberry aroma, juicy, framboise like sweetness, tart aroma. Flavor is intense raspberry juice, not artificial, refreshing tartness in the back and more raspberry lingers in the finish. A lot of raspberry packed into this.

Bomber bottle, fresh in the WI. Pours ruby, red, mahogany. Beautiful raspberry aroma. Taste is sweet raspberry tart with a bit of a sour beer base back. Its a great beer for a gorgeous summer afternoon.

29.06.2014, 0,75l bottle @ home, courtesy of RobertDale:
Nice slightly bubbly mediumlasting head. Aroma is sweet, slightly concentrated fruity, raspberry syrup, sugar, grass, caramel malts.Taste is sweet sour-ish, sugar, soda powder, slightly concentrated fresh raspberry juice, raspberry lollipop, grass, berry skin, caramel malts. Nice fresh light acidic mouthfeel. Nice and easy drinking.
Received in a trade from BVery -- This is easily the best fruit beer I have ever had the pleasure of enjoying. This is just a wow in a bottle. Very fruity and juicy.

750 ml bottle shared by Jon. Thanks man! Pours a translucent color of, well, raspberries. Poofy bubbles make up the thin head of this beautiful glass of beer. Aroma is, again, raspberries, but really fresh ones. Amazing - this is beer? Flavor is deliciously sweet raspberries, not much else to report. I am reminded of the complexity of pie. All around amazing flavors, crisp finish. Delicious. From notes 1/23/10 (Geist Dark Lord tasting)

aroma: raspberry, vanilla, raspberry, raspberry

appearance: golden red body; creamy white head; lively carb bubble action for that a$$

taste: sweet and tart raspberry, sweet vanilla ice cream, ends with a slightly sour berry note. 

palate: creamy with refreshing soda like carb fizziness, no shizzy. finishes long and juicy, slightly bitter/sour.

greatest fruit beer ive had yet. beats out rubaeus by a slim but definitive margin.

Bottle. Pours brown with red hues and off-white head. Aroma is strong raspberry, very fruity. Taste is very raspberry, sweet but good tartness, great carbonation, tart and sweet, great flavor- really good!!

Pours a dark red/brown with a half finger of quickly dissipating wispy head. Nose is dominated by raspberry jam. Taste is raspberry jam, extremely sweet, a bit of planty dryness at the very end. Mouthfeel is a bit syrupy. I want more tart in this beer. Really tasty, but a bit too sweet. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured a hazy reddish brown with a thin white head. Nose is huge raspberry with some vegetal notes. Taste is sweet raspberry with minimal tartness. There is also some spice on the backend. Love this beer.

Wow. This is just an amazing beverage. Sweet and refreshing. The depth of flavor New Glarus gets out of their beers is incredible. Pours red with a thin head. Full raspberry flavor is present throughout. Not too tart. A great framboise. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750ml bottle from Rays in Tosa - cellar aged 6 months and shared at fridge temperature with Randy & Laura for Memorial Day. Pours a pinkish brown with a pink head leaving some lace. Aroma has a very strong raspberry presence, with sweet and tart fruits involved as well. Definitely raspberry-forward. Taste brings more raspberry leading, with some tart fruit presence (cranberries?) and sweetness (apples?) in the mix. Some certain oaky barrel presence. Slightly carbonated. Light to medium bodied. Finishes sweet and tart. Somewhere in the mix between a wine, a wine cooler and a fruit drink. Not their best fruit beer, IMO, but still a very solid, tasty effort.

750mL bottle. Pours a ruby red with big pinkish tinted head, exceptional retention and decent lacing. Nose is a freaking berry farm, sweet like syrup... not sure how tart this Tart will be (Im doubtful). Mouth is (as I guessed) pretty damn sweet. Not horrible, but a little too much raspberry soda for my taste -- more like one of those wine coolers the girls were pounding in the 80s. There is wheat evident on the finish, and the mouthfeel too, but the berries overwhelm everything else. Picked this up at a Walmart in WI... which shouldve been my first clue. I may be in the minority, but I just didnt dig this beer.
Bottle. Pours a clouded amber with a beige head. Smells like a box of fresh raspberries. Flavor is sweet lambic up fromy with lots of fresh tart raspberry. Slight yogurt sour in the finish. Wow!

Waxed bomber. Dark ruby red with a big pink head and heavy lacing. Tart raspberry, honey, and dry woody notes. Fruity sweetness with puckering tartness. Medium body with a bubbly feel. The tart acidity costs the mouth.
Raspberry on the aroma, with just a hint of yeast. Raspberry on the palate, finishes with just enough tartness to balance out the sweetness from the berries. Amazingly done.

Excellent offering. Pours out with a fluffy slightly off white head. Looks as you would expect with a dark raspberry coloring. The aroma pulls your nose to the glass with an explosion of fresh raspberries. Just a bit of tartness and tons of fresh berries. Excellent job New Glarus.

750ml bottle. Huge thanks to RobertDale via six bottle shipper across America. Pours a dark reddish amber color with a small fizzy off white head. Aroma of sweet and tart fresh raspberries, and hint of funk. Taste is delicious and refreshing. Fresh sweet raspberry purée, followed by a slight tartness, and hints of funk. Soo good!!

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2014 Looks amazing! light red with solid foam. Aroma is sugary raspberry confectionery. Taste is raspberry lollies with sherbert inside. Fizzy. Ashen quality to finish. Definitely a sipper. Too sweet for me but good fun.
750 ml bottle from a trade. Thanks Al! Loads of fresh raspberries on the nose. Almost like raspberry soda. Taste is jammy sweet with some light malt backbone and tartness coming through.
Thanks to Weezel for trying this one. A solid sour beer where the raspberry dominates more than the sour. Nice and mild.
Bottle, poured into a flute. Fruitty raspberry aroma, sweet raspberry flavor. Was never a fan of fruit beers but this one has me rethinking that.
Had this at a great neighborhood tasting. Thanks to everyone for sharing! Had so much fun!
so glad these arent more sour than they could be. nice and mild but so good.
Bottle share in 2013. Pour is deep red with a small pink head. Aroma is raspberry puree and sour berries. Flavor is sweet and tart - raspberries, acidic, tart. Great.

Sample at Ale Alpharetta. Pours a hazy reddish-brown, with practically no head. The aroma is overwhelmingly raspberries. I struggle to come up with any other way to describe the aroma, except maybe some light caramel and wheat in the background. Heavy, fruity sweetness, and nicely tart. Medium body, sticky, sharp, and acidic. This is the way fruit beers should be done!

Bottle is probably 3 - 4 years old. 
Aroma is dominated by a raspberry jam character. Some light malt character in the background supporting the jam notes. Some light tartness. 
Pours a murky, copper-brown with some amber hues and a medium sized, tan head of medium light thickness. Recedes fairly quickly to the edges where it lingers for a bit before disappearing. Light lacing and small legs. 
Flavor starts with a fairly strong sweetness and a moderate raspberry jam character. Like the aroma there is a medium light pale malt and faint chocolate background character. Faint bitterness with some light tartness. Really tastes a lot like liquid jam. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall a very sweet, jammy beer with tons of raspberry flavor and aroma. Light malt background notes and faint tartness. A beer for non beer people.

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2014 Tart, sugary-sweet aroma. Very clean sourness as well. Pours a burgundy red color with thin white head. Taste is of wild raspberries and is wonderful! The sweetness is balanced perfectly with sourness. If you live near Wisconsin you need to get your hands on any of the New Glarus fruit sours.
Fairly clear Ruby Red color with a fizzy red head, mild carbonation. Nice raspberry/cranberry aroma. Sweet raspberry taste! Light body with some moderate carbonation. Tasty!
Strong raspberry aroma. Smootg texture. Very rich fruit raspberry flavour. Very sweet. A little to sweet for my liking.

I could smell this beer all day. Fresh raspberries, slightly herbal, oak, and a little cough syrup. Sharp acidity, fruit sugars, herbal funk, and oak leave you wanting more and more. Probably one of the best framboises Ive ever had.

Bottle poured into glass. A dark auburn color with a fingers worth of brown head. Aroma of raspberries. Taste is like a raspberry warhead. Very lively carbonation. Very sweet but not cloyingly so. Excellent.
Pours dark reddish maroon. Sweet malty berry nose. Thick syrupy body. Fizzy. Taste is smooth tart berry. Rivals Belgian red for top of the ng heap.

Bottle date: unk

A: pours a cheery brown with 2 fingers of the lightest pink head. This falls quickly to a sheet of the same. No lace. near excellent clarity.

S: Raspberries, slightly tart. Not much else. As advertised.

T: Sweet with hints of tart raspberries. A little too sweet for my preferences....EDIT: I threw a cork in this and returned to it several days later to find the beer much more enjoyable. A bit of oxidation and flattening out brought the flavors into a more balanced profile. 

M: Medium body (light syrup) with spritely carbonation. Dry finish makes my mouth water. 

O: Very fruity and very tasty. I much prefer this to the WI Belgian Red, which has too much cherry on it.

Serving type: bottle

07-19-2011

This has to be one of my top rated beers. It's not your typical hop beer. Definitely a fruit beer, but I LOVE fruit, so this is right up my alley. Aroma of awesome cherry and raspberries. Creamy offwhite head which lasts. Fair lacing. Nice tartness which lasts for a long while, eventually leading off to a metallic aftertaste. Plan on burping a ton as this is a highly carbonated beer. Pure awesome sauce.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Good beer. A little too tart for my palate, but the beer label warned me. Good Raspberry tones, decent beer.

Clear, ruby color with a single stream of rising carbonation. Slight, quickly dissipating head with no lacing. Dull and lackluster in appearance. Sweet malt aroma, with no hop aroma to speak of. No yeast aroma, just a strong, tart, raspberry smell. Strong, sweet malt flavor, of tart raspberries. Well-built, slightly complex with a nice herbal hop backbone. As the brewer intended and a great representation of the fruit beer style. Light, smooth and effervescent mouthfeel. Overall, a great beer that I would buy again, although the sweet, tartness can be a little overwhelming.

Bottle shared with multiple others at brew club. Pours a thin white head over a light brown ((SRM 20) body......nose is raspberry, light cereal, no hops, heavy fruity esters from the raspberry.....taste is raspberry, slightly sweet, leading to a mild raspberry sweet finish......mouth feel medium, slightly sticky, slight astrigency, carbonation makes a foamy sensation, with a mild acid finish. Nicely done, raspberry is ascendent, but not overly dominant, light acid and carbonation make for a refreshing experience. BJCP 7/3/15/4/7

Pour from bottle courtesy of zizzybalubba @ ECU vs Tulsa football game. Thanks BroMontana!! Red hue with a mostly lasting reddish fizzy head. Strong aroma of raspberry throughout the entire experience. Strong tart raspberry initial taste with a moderate lasting tart rasberry taste on the finish. I have had several bottles of this in the past and it never disappoints.

A: Solid Off Reddish Hue, Passes Mild Light, Mild Pinkish Head, Some Lacing

S: Lots of Raspberries, Mild Cranberry

T: Mildly Sweet Raspberries, Mild Tart Cherry

M: Average Carbonation, Light to Medium Bodied, Semi Sweet, Mildly Tart

Overall, pretty solid for the style, I had the 2009 version recently and it was like drinking raspberry juice where the 2010 was mildly tart.
Very good beer. Great balance. Very refreshing. Could be a bit more tart, but that is just being picky.

Big Big ups to Bytemesis for the bottle, thanks man! Nice dark red pour, minimal lacing, white/red head. Wonderful aroma of raspberries, mild oak. Sweet jesus this is good, mild tartness up front, followed by a nice touch of raspberry sweetness, freakishly drinkable, very little acidity, extremely well balanced ..God damn I wish I was sitting somewhere warm drinking this...
Poured from the bottle. Color is cloudy ruby red. Aroma is nice raspberry sweetness. Flavor is mild sweetness, raspberry tartness, and is light and refreshing. Really like this one.

Big thanks to tectactoe for the split. One of my bigger wants for a long time. Exactly how the name is. Nice raspberry flavors with a decent tartness. I actually expected a little more sourness. Still good.
Voodoo barrel release share. Poured pink brown with min head. Nice sour aroma with berry. Excellent raspberry taste slight sourness. Winner
Never knew I would like fruit style beers til I found this one. The aroma is delicious and true. The taste is clearly raspberry and is not too sweet or cloying. Real taste treat.
Fifth to New Glarus flutes. Sweet raspberry aroma. Cloudy red. Tart and fizzy. Sweet and sour.

Pour Murky/hazy brown/red, with a deliciously-looking frothy off-white head. 
Aroma is really delicious, with lots and lots of raspberry. Fruit gum, sour sweets, slight green apples with some tart to it. 
The taste is slightly sweet upfront, with a nice amount of sourness to it, and faint bitter notes. 
Average bodied, with a slightly fizzy carbonation. I really did enjoy this.

Lets face it, this is about as good of a fruit beer as you can get with only the current defunct Belgian Red to rival it. This pours a cloudy, reddish color with a fizzy light pink head. The aroma erupts with the scent of sweet raspberries. The taste is amazing with sweet delicious raspberries. Only downside is that you really do need a drinking buddy otherwise 1 bottle is way too much sweetness for 1 person alone.

Bottle with the Medici. Bottle in WI. Pours dark ruby red an opaque, light reddish foamy head. Nose is potent berries, vanilla, subtle barrel notes. Champagne effervescence, potent berries, faint vanilla and oak, light and sour drying on the finish. Classy beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Woodmans Onalaska. Pours ruby red with an inch of white foam. Leaves some lacing in the glass. Massive raspberry notes on the nose. Lots of fruit on the tongue. Its flavorful while feeling natural. Sweet without being cloying. Taste lingers a long time. Fantastic!

Bottle split with DiarmaidBHK - pours clearish ruby with a nice pillowy peachy tan head. The taste is just right. Tart without being cloying or aggressive about it. Makes me want to fly to Wisconsin to get some more! Very tasty!

UPDATED: JUL 21, 2014 2-year old 750ml bottle. BIG thanks to beerpig317 for sharing his last bottle with me! Slightly reddish brown color. Thin beige head. Super good tart raspberry smell. Carbonated raspberries and oak. Makes my mouth water. Moderate sweet taste, not cloying, with a big tart raspberry finish. Aftertaste is like I just inhaled a mouthful of raspberries. Lightly syrupy, but a bit dry in the finish. Palate buzzes with tart raspberries long after each sip. Super good, flavorful stuff. 9/4/8/4/16 Re-rate, 7/20/14: Bottle, thanks to beerpig317 for sharing. I mistakenly thought I hadnt rated this yet, intended it to be my 6K rate. Clear red color. Off-white head. Loose lace. Great color. Awesome big raspberry taste. Kind of syrupy, lightly spicy in a raspberry way. Moderate tart taste, moderate sweet. Medium-plus body. Kind fo slick syrupy texture. Some creme. Awesome raspberry fruit beer. Would have been a great one for 6K. Tarra tasted it, too sour for her. 8/4/8/4/15 [aroma score lowered 1 pt]

Bottle thanks to adnielsen ! Pours a muddy rust color with a finger or two of eggshell foam. The nose is pure raspberry, touch of vanilla and old barrel notes. The palate is full of ripe juicy berry goodness; cherry, raspberry.. nice tartness leads into a subtle bitterness on the finish.

Aroma of fresh fruit. Appearance was not what I was expecting...nice amber red, with tan head. Beautiful raspberry sweetness, that balances nicely at the end with tartness. Finishes nice an refreshing.

Raspberry tart is awesome. It is not like any beer, even a lambic. The acidity is nice but not beyond accessible. Fruit character is intense but also complex and developed. It seems slightly aged and has what appear to be secondary characteristics. Although the acidity may not be high enough for extended aging, Id really like to hold on to a few of these to see what happens over time. Id wager they get more interesting over 3-5 years.

Bottle as pictured. Thanks again to Adam Jackson.Tart berry notes, raspberry puree, lots of berry sweetness that covers up anything else. No artificial fruit at all. Well balanced. Yet the texture is really sticky and syrupy. Really awesome dessert brew and I understand why everybody goes totally crazy for it. High end of the fruit beer style. Easy to drink a fruit beer this well developed.

This beer is as perfect as they come. Completely true to style, with rich flavor, amazing color, and an outstanding aroma. You must find this beer and try it. I have not found it outside of Wisconsin.

Bottle with Ray. Pours a deep maroon with thin head and limited lacing. Smells like fresh homemade raspberry jam. Nice tartness, amazing raspberry flavor. Virtually no alcohol presence. New Glarus continuously makes incredible fruit beers and this is one of my favorites.

750 ml bottle from JStax. Pours a deep red color with a purple hue. Small pink foamy head that fades to a ring. Love the appearance. Smells like delicious raspberry jam. Taste has a nice sweetness which is slightly overpowered by the tart, acidic finish. Its pretty awesome though, liquid raspberries. Medium to thick body with a nice soft carbonation. Love the mouthfeel, it seems to be silky smooth as your drinking it but then a bit sticky after you swallow. Overall, a small step below Belgian Red to me but still great.
Bomber. Light burgundy. Sweet raspberry aroma. Great balance of sweet and tart.
Bottle. Awesome fruit beer. Great balance. Nice tart flavor with just the right amount of carbonation. Very enjoyable.

Pours a dark reddish brown color with a brownish white head. Smells of very good raspberries. Taste lives up to the name... Tart raspberry flavor. Very enjoyable beer, and the wife even liked it!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750ml bottle into a HF wine glass. Huge thanks to yamar68 for this one!

A - Pours a deep dark red/violet hue that is clear but lets little light through. Looks very wine like. Two fingers of dense tan/pink stained foam forms but settles into some thin patching. Swirling does generate an impressive new layer of foam and leaves behind some lacing. This might be a fruit beer, but it is not thin in the least bit.

S - Raspberry jam. Thats it. Obviously its pretty one dimensional, but when that lone dimension is amazingly ripe and tart raspberries itss pretty acceptable. Oh how I love this aroma.

T - Tart and sweet raspberries with just a touch of wheat which is found in the other NG fruit beers. The finish is ever so slightly acidic. It gets to be a bit much after a while but it absolutely nails the raspberry flavor. Mouth feel is thick and syrupy with moderate carbonation.

O - New Glarus really impresses me with these fruit beers. This is just the most honestly raspberry forward thing Ive have ever had that wasnt an actual raspberry. Not as exciting as Serendipity but just as wonderful as the Belgian Red.
Pours a dark purple with a white head. Aroma of sour raspberries. Just like a juice with a sour taste.

750mL bottle. Awesome.

A: Swirling pour yields a dense foam headand a very bright red body with purple tones.

N: Raspberry syrup, maraschino cherries, sugar, and some marionberry. Very very fruity.

T: Super, super sweet with a sour tone to balance. 

M: Light and well carbonated.

O: A dessert beer if there ever was one. Pair with rhubarb pie or somethin of that nature. Will become too much after time, despite the ABV.
Tons of raspberry, with sweet and tart flavors. Very refreshing and well balanced.

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2014 Bottle from a friend in Wisconsin. Wax top 750 ml. Pours a deep dark red with a big creamy pink head. Cool look. Aroma is amazing. Fresh raspberries and more fresh raspberries. More sweet than tart aroma. Wow! Tart up front quickly fades into sweet raspberries that sit and linger on the palate.  Tart comes back with another sip. Oh man this is awesome. Some oak dryness and ever so slight bitter keep this from being too sweet. Light to medium mouthfeel--expected lighter--with no hint of alcohol (pretty low anyway). This is pretty awesome.
Wow crazy sour with raspberries and deliciousness. Super tart but overall very good sour.

Bottle. Pours reddish brown with a big white head. Nose is all raspberry syrup. Taste is much the same. Sweet and tart simultaneously. Palate is full with a lovely carb. Delicious but maybe a little one dimensional. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
750 ml. bottle.  Pours a clear burgundy with a decent creamy head.  Aroma of fruit and wood.  Taste is raspberries, earth, and wood.  Sweet and tart.  Very much enjoyed this.

New Glarus rarely makes its way down to Georgia, thus I jumped when provided the opportunity to order this brew.  Pours a beautiful ruby red.  This lightly carbonated beer tastes like a raspberry jolly rancher..  All raspberry everything.  Interesting, but not sure of a scenario where I would reach for this brew.  Glad for the opportunity, but will probably never drink this beer again.  Brick Store Pub - Decatur, GA

Bottle from Ben, thanks! Pours dark reddish brown with low head.  Smell is sweet dark fruits,  taste is sweet raspberries with nice acidity on the finish.  way to sweet, good for a dessert drink or breakfast.

750ml bottle to snifter (thanks jmborggren). Looks good; a fairly transparent copperish amber with thin off-white lacing. Smells solid; tart raspberries. Tastes like it smells, only better, with a nice mouthfeel. Damn tasty!
Wow.  Raspberry everywhere.  Super sweet yet nice tartness also. Just all around good stuff. Well done
Yummy. I love raspberries and this is a raspberry loaded beer! Great on top of ice cream.

Thanks Adam for sending this one to me! Hes sending more of these so figured Id crack this one open and give it a try. ITs currently 9 months old so I hope its still great!

A -  Very much filtered with no sediment at all, gorgeous blood red appearance with a 2 finger head.

S - The nose has nothing like fake raspberry syrup. It is pretty much all earthy sort of muddy / grassy fruit nose.

T -  Wow. Simple yet so complex. The malt or beer itself sort of takes a back seat to this gigantic raspberry taste. Its a handful of raspberries in a glass with carbonation. Thats the best way to put it. 

M - Nice big mouthfeel on the swish. tart and dry finish. very grape-skin like as I rub my tongue over my teeth

O - Very drinkable. Simply ann incredible fruit beer! Possibly the best Ive ever had.
Fruity sweet aroma with a hint of spice. Clear auburn with white head that leaves a fair amount if lacing. Very smooth. Very fruity with a hint of yeast. Slightly tart finish.

Bottle picked up in Madison Wisconsin. Pours an extremely cloudy dark red almost mahogany. Nose is so sweet and fruity. Tastes like raspberry jam. Super sweet, tart as hell, a touch bitter. There is an element of soap too. Just sugar bomb. Really really good.

Dark red with a rosy head.
Strong, sweet raspberry aroma.
Nice raspberry flavour, very authentic and natural.
Not overly sweet.
A good one.

Wow New Glarus.  Just keep knocking it out of the park.  Shared with the wife as she clamours for NGs fruit beers.  Big, big raspberry sherbert and tart but soft vinous nose. Huge sweet raspbery flavors with a littly tart finish.  It is quite sweet, but after splitting the bottle, I was still wanting more.  Just incredible that at 4%, there is that much flavor.

Pours a clear raspberry color with a frothy rose head and swirls of lace.  I purchased two bottles in June 2012, drank one immediately, and opened the other today (10 months later). The fresh bottle was like raspberry syrup, while the aged one is like raspberry wine, sweet-sour raspberry flavor with a little warming in the finish.  Delicate, light in the stomach, yet a full flavor that lingers in the finish.  High recommendation.

Hazy dark red burgundy with a small creamy rose head.  Aroma is red fruit, rapsberry and some sea-like.  Flavor is deep sour raspberry, very intense with some lemony notes, and a fruity, acid aftertaste, very nice. Medium palate, start filling but ends dry, complex, refreshing and very drinkable. Great.
Raspberry forward and very sweet.  Has a nice tartness to round out the palate.  Very drinkable.
Surprisingly tart with biting raspberry sourness. Strong fruit base, supported by a mouthful of fresh fruit. Yeah, far more sour than my last few bottles, and I love it.

The first thing I noticed about this beer is its aroma of muddled berries and chocolate. The beer pours a dark ruby read, and comes to a creamy cocoa head that dissolves rather quickly. The taste is absolutely amazing: it's like drinking dessert. It's unlike a beer, it's a rich creamy chocolate and raspberry taste with slight hints of coffee and cocoa. The beer washes down and leaves a light feeling on the palate. This is an astonishing drink in-general. Enjoy every sip, friends.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Another of the great fruit beers from New Glarus.  Just a touch below the cherry, but still very, very good.  I wish they would expand their distribution beyond Wisconsin.  Always got to stock up on visits to the Dairy state.
22oz bottle pours a murky amber with light off white head. Strong raspberry aromas. Raspberry with a hit of tart

Slightly hazy garnet pour with a pinkish head that fades fairly quickly. Aroma is raspberry, apples, wood, and earthy. Taste is raspberry, green apple, and wood. Also fairly earthy.  Really nice tartness to go along with the sweetness. Dry palate. Soft carbonation. Great beer.

This was divine. Bottle into snifter. Body is dark brown with garnet hues all throughout. Nose is big raspberry preserves and some earthy/oakey notes. Taste is sweet raspberry jam and tart fresh berries. Drinkable as hell, with a low abv and a load of fruity, tart, sweet flavors. Awesome.
bottle. Red with minimal head. Huge raspberry flavor. Super tart and fruity. Goes down so easy.

750ml bottle via OmegaX - thanks BRAAAH
Appearance - Copper body, thin lacing
Aroma - Raspberries, leaves, apple juice
Taste - Juicy, tart raspberries, mellow vanilla, oak, clean dry finish

Coming from a tasting of Serendepity, I can now vouch for New Glarus fruit beers. Holy shit what a treat - drinkable as hell too. Thanks so much Jordan!!!

Bottle shared with my wife. Raspberry, cranberry, ripe fruit on nose. Beautiful ruby-red with light purplish white head that bubbles vigorously and then disappears. Sweet, tart, fruit. Sparkling fruit punch. Slick mouth coating, light body, lively carbonation. A little syrupy. Exceptional.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Red pour, 1 finger of head.  Raspberry jam aroma. tart on the sides of the tongue, raspberry, sour candy taste.  Easy drinking.  New glarus makes the best fruit beers.
Brilliant raspberry jam nose. Balanced taste with raspberries and tart lambic. Very drinkable beer.
Sour and raspberry.  Verry good stuff. Nicely balanced.  Good amount of carbonation.
From an old note, shared up at Proof:  sweet soda-like berry, sweet and sour vibe - awesome - jammy - drinkable - try again - 8.2
From a bomber in tulip glass. Light barnyard aroma. Flavor is sweet raspberries with little more tartness than the fruit itself. A little bit of dough. Long sweet finish. Nice.

Bottle courtesy of changeup45.  Tart raspberry and creamy malt aroma. Pours amber tinged garnet with a moderate creamy pink head. Tart raspberry and creamy lactic malt flavor. Medium creamy body, lively carbonation. New Glarus does the most amazing fruit beers.
Aroma of raspberry and nothing else.  Pours light red with a fluffy head.  Taste is super concentrated raspberries.  Very sweet and tart.  A little too intensely fruity.

750ml bottle in a tulip.  Pours ruby/purple with a lacy, light beige head.  Aroma of raspberries, some spiciness, hints of wheat and oak, and light bitterness.  Flavor mainly of rapsberries, with a good balance of everything else.  Average texture.  A pretty good fruit beer.

Semi-clear red with orange hue. Small reddish head. Aroma of raspberry, and maybe a little powdery. Flavor of raspberries of course. Full flavor. Sweet. Very nice tartness. Great medium body. Great balance. Crisp and clean. Each sip leaves me wanting another one.

Sparking red-orange color. small white head. scent of raspberry and fruit, though not very strong.  Excellent sweet, smooth, raspberry flavor.  Leaves the perfect taste in your mouth.  This fruit beer is tough to beat.

Bright red-orange, off-white head. Nose is raspberries, raspberry jam, a fresh box of crayons. Taste is semi-tart raspberries, strawberries, fruity yogurt, some sharpness, slight tartness to the finish. High carbonation, medium mouthfeel.

Bottle courtesy of ghostface.. Thank you. Pour is mahogany red, with a light foamy head that dissipates to nothing. Light lacing. Aroma is sweet cranberry, raspberry, light apple, with some light yeast. Very fruity.. Almost like a wine cooler but the yeast gives it a beer character. Taste is raspberry, raspberry seeds.. Drinks like a soda. Def sweet but carbonation makes it pleasant.. Tart finish accents the raspberry well. A delightful fruit treat.. Served well with chocolate.
Another New Glarus bottle courtesy of GhostFace. Amazing raspberry aroma and taste, perfectly balancing sweet and tart, while still letting wheat and spicy hops shine through.

Relatively clear reddish brown with a good sized pale head that leaves some lacing. Aroma is raspberries, brown sugar. Syrupy mouthfeel, heavy on the palate, lengthy sweet finish. Taste is raspberry syrup, raspberry jam, fresh raspberry. Sweet but very tasty.

Pours a deep red with an off white head. Aroma is strong raspberry with some light perfume. The taste is tart raspberries with a sweet earth perfume taste at the end. Has a medium body and is very fizzy, overall a great raspberry beer thats not too overpowering.

Bottle. Pours hazy pale red with a light off-white head. Aroma is malty, fresh, sweet, tart raspberry. Taste is very fresh and juicy and tart. Nothing cloying Best New Glarus ive had yet. Incredibly drinkable.

Bottle at sampling session. From notes (Oct. 8, 2011). Big raspberry nose. Clear dark red color with pink lacing. Great concentrated raspberry initial, some wheat notes, very light spiciness, some pepper. Very sweet, overall. An interesting "beer," which is very refreshing and tart.

Pours a light ruby red with a small amount of head.  Slight raspberry odor.  Really strong raspberry frutiness that ends with a sour finish.  Pretty tasty, and thats coming from someone who doesnt really like raspberry beers.
Nice deep red color.  Very tart and not too sweet.  Served this to the non-beer relatives for the holidays and they loved it.  Very nice beer.

Pours a ruby/chestnut colour with offwhite head. Raspberries. Delicious sweet and tart smelling raspberries. Effervescent and bubbly on the tongue. Expertly balanced. Sweet and tart raspberries. Simple, delicious. If only all fruit beers could come even close to this.

Bottle. Clear red pour, light bubbly white head. Aroma is very raspberry, tons of menthol, toothpaste, cough syrup. Taste is sweet, fruity, light, very syrupy. These New Glarus fruit beers are really not my thing.
This is very nice beer. Not too sweet, not too tart! I drank it from a champagne flute I havent used since my wedding over 21 years ago just like the bottle says to do!
Reddish brown colour with off white head. Nice aroma of sour vinous sweet vinegar, raspberries obviously. Taste is initially quite sweet but the tartness comes around. Tasty.

Aroma is sweet, full, and true to raspberry. Appearance is a nice red with a great head. Taste is sweet and full with a wild edge. It's very drinkable while very decedent. Palate is has a nice sour edge, but also dry. No lingering bad taste. Very good beer!

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2014 [4689-20120817] Bottle. Fresh raspberry malt aroma. Hazy, brown amber body with a medium-lasting foamy off-white head. Raspberry fresh fruit flavour has a lingering fruity aftertaste. Medium body. Delicious. (9/4-/9/4/18) 4.4
(@ Campground Brewdown 2012, Millmont, PA)
Overheard: "Good luck, Stumblelina."

[6333B-20140522] Bottle. Intensely raspberry fruity aroma, like youre becoming a raspberry its so intense. Hazy, reddish brown body with a quick foamy off-white head. Fruity sweet intense raspberry. Medium body has a light tart finish. Un-frreakin-believable, all I sense is delicious fruity raspberry. (10/3/10/4/18) 4.5
(c/o HogTownHarry, w/ him, blankboy, GregClow, jercraigs)
Overheard: "You can just slop the rest of that in here if you dont want it."

The flavor is on the light side, but still incredibly enjoyable and refreshing. Sweet and tart, as expected. It tastes different from most  lambics due to the lack of Belgian yeast flavors. The carbonation adds a lot of depth to the palate, and for me this was one of the best things about this beer. It isnt fizzy; instead there is a light, bubbly froth that reminds me of a well-made cappuccino. Subtle and well-crafted.

Bottle: Clear mahogany red with a white head and spotty lacing.  Amazing tangy aroma of rasberries, strawberries, and tartness.  Delightful flavors abound with a tangy raspberry jam and a bit of dryness.  So yummy!
Bottle pour into a flute.  I like this just a bit less than the comparable Wisconsin Red.  Im curious if a low carbonation version of something like this would be good?

Pour is dark dark red with a soda-like head. Aroma is a whole bucket of sweet raspberries, like an awesome jam. Taste is similar, almost like a malty raspberry soda. A bit tart. Normally this wouldnt be my style, but this beer is very well executed. The taste doesnt really linger, which leaves me wanting more. Good thing this is only 4% so I can enjoy more of it.
Bottle. Pours a dark red with incredible raspberry aroma. Flavor is sweet raspberrys with a tart almost sour end. Very nice and sweet

Serving: 750 ml. bottle.  It pours a darker reddish brown with a very slight head.  The nose is a little musty with slight papery notes.  Not much in the way of fruit.  The flavor is almost sickeningly sweet.  The flavor makes me think of raspberry pop tarts.  Lacks depth, tartness, and complexity.  Only mildly better than Lindemans.  Light to medium body with lower carbonation.  Nice fruit flavor, but way too sweet.  I dont see the hype with this one.

Purchased this beer at SAMs club.  When poured this beer has a lacy pink head that quickly disappears.  The color is a rich deep red.  The raspberry flavor and  tartness is definitely there but you can get a slight malty flavor as well.  I like that the flavor lingers on your pallet without turning becoming stale.
Bottle. Pours a darker cherry red with brown lowlights. Very little head. Aroma is a tart fruit, some slight breadiness. Taste is of tart raspberry, tangy on the tongue. Very nice for the style!

bottle shared by mathieuc, thanks! pours almost clear golden-orange with a nice beige-orange-ish head, some retention. peppery raspberry, spicy malts, sweet, lactose-like feeling, raspberry jam and coulis. some tartness - was hoping a bit more. spicy sweetness. average carbonation, light body, nice herbal-citrusy finish. very good fruit beer!

Bottle (750 ml). Shared by mathieuc, thanks Mathieu!  Deep reed with a medium diminishing head and fair lacing. Aroma is of intense raspberries jam with sweetness and cherry notes. Taste is pretty sweet but not cloying (at least, no for the quantity I had) with strong notes of raspberry jam, slight tartness and notes of spices (which create a warming impression). Mouthfeel is sirupy. Theres no doubt that this on heck of a fruit beer and I like it almost as much as Wisconsin Belgian Red, but I dont think I would be able to drink a 750 ml by myself, even half of that may be too much. Still, a fun beer to drink!

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2014 Jam nose and jam taste. Nice and real raspberry presence, I never thought of it being artificial. A touch too sweet though, I wouldnt want to chug a whole 750ml by myself but split 8-way it was pretty good. It even has a jam texture/mouthfeel but more liquid, mind you. Great fruit beer, the best Ive had to date for sure!
Tart is an understatement. Ive just become a fan of fruit beers. Sweet, sour, and dry.  Reminds me of Clearly Canadian with booze, which in my book, isnt a bad thing.

Pours deep red with a thick white head that disappears quickly. Aroma of raspberry and fruit. Taste starts sweet and turns tart quickly. Flavor lingers on your palate for several seconds. I am not a big fan of fruit beers so this one is not my style. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: NOV 3, 2012 Bottle. Pours reddish deep amber with a huge creamy pinkish tan head that dissipates with minimal lacing. Aroma is raspberry. Flavor its the same, muted raspberry, minimal  tartness. Quite nice.

750ml bootle, dark reddyish color, with a light pinkyish head, very good raspberry puree, fresh raspberry juice, sweet and sour wild raspberry nose with a faint oak barrel, yeast funkiness accent, and with a raspberry mousse pastry, tart red berry note in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a sweet raspberry puree, raspberry jam, sweet and sour red berry character with a mild funk wild yeast, oaky, raspberry jelly candy flavour, leading towards a raspberry sweet jam, lingering sour, tart red berry finish.

Tulip at Coopers Tavern, Madison, WI.  Deep red with thin white head, no lacing.  Aroma of raspberries, peaches, other ripe mixed berries, tart candy.  Flavors are assertively sweet and fruity, then tart, then finishing lightly sweet again.  Holds its own against the more established lambics.
Not much different than the Belgian Red except it has less head and texture. I like it but it needs more carbonation!

Bottle. This is really is an excellent fruit beer. Subtle, flavorful, drinkable, and ultimately just fruity. Great, bold flavors for such low abv. Aroma is soft, but livens up as it warms. Its tart, but not necessarily sour with a nice bready quality, not too unlike a hefe. A decent carbonation and feels almost like a white wine. Notes of raspberry of course, but also pears, melon, banana, and red licorice, all sitting a top a yeasty bread. I really enjoyed the subtleties and quality fruit flavor. High quality here.
From 25 oz bottle shared at home. Pours a brownish red with a tan head. Sweet but tart mouthful of raspberries. Wonderful.

Poured from a 750 ml bottle received generously from unclerudy. Pours a dark, translucent brown with a hint of purple to it. The aroma is absolutely loaded with raspberries and giving just a hint of tartness. The taste is very similar to a raspberry jolly rancher, but theres also another layer of a sort of doughy nature. This would be a great beer to cook with, especially for desserts.
