Much like the Belgian Red, the sweetness is such that drinking this whole bottle is a pretty good feat.  It’s a wonderful beer and New Glarus has shown the ability to nail this style.

Not much to describe about this beer... except... its raspberries... pure raspberry aroma .... and pure raspberry flavor with a hint of acidity in the finish.   Pours a murky purple/red with a nice pink head.   Love the raspberry seeds floating around everywhere.  Extremely drinkable for something that looks thick like syrup, however you get none of that.   I would love to have seen them go bigger than 4% though, the flavors could hold for sure.

Super dark red with pinkish-grey head. Foamy, extremely heady and thick aroma, bit of salt up front and acidity in the middle. Thick body. You’d expect something this tart to hurt your teeth, but it’s definitely drinkable and beer-like. Wonderful.

Rating 300!  Thanks to James for the bottle.  Murky dark red/light maroon color.  Quite inviting.  Nose is fresh muddled raspberries, very tart, with hiints of sour cherries and fresh lemon juice.  An earthy but very fresh and fruity aroma.  Taste is fresh raspberries; pleasantly acidic.  A crowd pleaser for sure.  Great beer.

Deep and dark marron color with a pink colored head.  Smell is wonderful.  Raspberries in strength and sweet like dessert.  Taste is sweet raspberries.  Dessert in a liquid form.  Almost anyone would like this beer.  Easily drinkable.

Ruby red color with a light pinkish head leaving excellent lacing. Rich smell of tart raspberries; reminds me a lot of the raspberry Jell-o my grandma used to make. Raspberries lightly pucker in your mouth, it’s really like eating raspberries fresh, only in liquid form. The amount of tartness is perfect, not overly acidic like how some raspberry framboise’s can be; sour, without the harsh. Carbonation dances on the tongue, enhancing each flavor. Medium bodied, finishes a bit dry. Incredibly drinkable, if this was in a nonic pint glass, I’d probably end up polishing off the bottle in no time.

Rating #1700.
Very deep cherry in colour, creamy and lasting off-white coloured head, good lacing.  The aroma is all raspberries - real raspberries, high sweetness, some jam.  The flavour is of raspberry jam, good tartness, sweet, rich.  Very sweet mouthfeel, medium body, medium carbonation.  Finishes long with lots of raspberry sweetness.
This is excellent.  Very well balanced, high drinkability, only 4% alc??  Seems like it should be more.  Incredible.  I actually tried a sip of this with a bit of peanut butter, it was amazing.
750ml bottle shared by beerhugger, thanks Steve.
Opened on February 2, 2008.
No date.

very fruity pleasant scent of raspberries.  Pour is very dark red with quickly disappearing head that dissolves into a pink ring around the outside of the glass.  taste is obviously raspberries, but it is done just right.  this is the best fruit beer I have ever had.  Very nice.  In my opinion, this is better than the Belgian Red.  I would certainly purchase this again.

2008 Bottle - Pours a murky reddish brown, does not have a "jewel-like sparkle,"  aroma is pure raspberries and it is wholly genuine, wonderfully tart raspberry flavour, malty and bright, this was a wonderful sour...

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2008 Drunk out of a Guinness pilsner glass, its a pretty heavy, reddish purple alcohol-containing substance that feels more like a wine and reminded me of sourish sweet tarts. Do not expect an ale-like drink.

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2009 [Bottle] shared by EddyB23. Pours a cloudy rose red with a small soapy head. Aroma is tons of fresh raspberries. mouthfeel is very fresh and crisp. Tons of raspberries and maybe a little tart wheat malt. The beer has the perfect balance of tart and sweet, with a nice acidity and a perfect amount of carbonation.
------ Appearance same as above. The aroma is much sweeter than I remember. The taste is also extremely sweet, and more than a glass of this makes my throat hurt from the sugars. Aside from that, the flavors are incredible with the crazy fresh raspberry.
UPDATED: OCT 26, 2008 pours burgundy with nice pink head smells of raspberries taste is all raspberries and tart with a slight hop flavor great fruit beer

Pours a dark burgundy in color.  Nice, good looking inch of head at the pour.  Smell is juicy, tart raspberry.
Taste is tart, sweet, dark, wonderful raspberries.  A little acidic on the taste as well.  Very good beer.  As tough as it is to say, I think I personally prefer the Belgian Red to this.  Both are incredible.

A really tasting brew all the way around. Beautiful bright red colour with plenty of raspberry flavor throughout the taste. Aromas very tropical and sweet, a light mouthfeel, plenty of carbonation with a champagne like head that foams up and quickly dissipates.

Bottle courtesy of MrFacto. Thanks!

Pours a hazy thick purple-red with a small purple head. Aroma of sourness, raspberries. Flavor is tart raspberry, and natural sweetness. Very smooth and complex as well, what an amazing fruit beer. YUM!

Amazing. This jem pours a deep raspberry/maroon with almost no head. It smells very very appealing like ripe raspberries. The flavor is outstanding, Sweet and rich with raspberries, then a slightly tart follow-through. Amazing!

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2008 Pours purple-red, I dont see the jewel like sparkle they rave about.  Aroma is rasberries.  Flavor is the same with some tart and a dry finish.   Best fruit beer Ive ever had, I cant wait to have the Belgian Red.  Must Get More.
cloudy purplish red. The aroma is rich fruit. Tastes like a raspberry cake or something. Really tasty.
Bottle - Thanks to Sune. Deep reddish - offwhite/light pink head. High raspberries, sweetness, light sourness, nice maltyness, brown sugar, high dryness, smooth body. Nice complexity. This is lovely.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2008 Bottle, courtesy Ughsmash I believe. Pours a drk murky rubyish pink, with lots of white lacing, and a nice frothy head. Pure gooey raspberries in the nose, prime sugar, distant caramel. Rich raspberries destroy the tastebuds, but in a good way, like vikings. Brown sugar and vanilla round things out. Mind-boggingly drinkable. Refreshing as hell and smooth. Good to the last drop. Ill take more of this, please.
Very nice.  Not as good as the Belgian Red though.  Aroma heavy of raspberries.  Color is maroon that is cloudy to the point of being totally opaque.  Taste is a good lingering pleasant raspberry.

Pours a beautiful deep purple with a medium of white head.  The raspberry aroma is heavenly! Very smooth and balanced sweet/tart flavor that is all raspberry.  Very little carbonation.  Easy to drink, fairly light.  This is a favorite of mine!!

nice, deep red color.  surprisingly enough, it smells like raspberries.  reddish head.  tastes like liquid raspberries. very smooth and flavorful.  im not usually a fan of fruit beers but this is pretty damn fantastic

Pours a reddish brown with a small diminshing tanned head. Sweet and slightly sour. Lots of raspberry- and Ribena aromas. Also tiny hints of ketchup. Mellow carbonation. Medium bodied. Sticky mouthfeel. Nice and fresh.

So raspberry delicious. Not syrup as I was almost expecting from that much fruit. Sweet and tart raspberry balance. Aroma and taste is unmistakable as pure raspberry goodness. Medium body makes it very drinkable.

Bottle thanks to nflmvp, thanks Steve!  Aroma of raspberries, ripe fruit, and a yeast.  Deep ruby red hue with a smaller than average sized light pinkish head that left some lace.  Flavor is sour and sweet and finishes tart and a little musty yeast.  Palate is light/medium body with soft carbonation.  Nice and refreshing, crisp and tart and sour.  Very good fruit beer.

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2008 Bottle courtesy tpd975. Pours a hazy red with a small pink head. Aroma is straight up fresh raspberries and not much else but it smells so damn good that I have to give it a perfect score for aroma. Taste is the same as aroma. Medium mouthfeel with a moderate amount of tartness and very mild bitterness. I never thought I would give a fruit beer this high of a score but this beer is so freaking good I cant help it. Made with extra YUM squared.

Totally delicious, in every way, shape and form.  Just a hint of woodiness in the nose, with lots of tart fruit flavors, but nicely balanced, very refreshing and crisp on the palate, very dry and quite lingering finish.

Opaque, dark raspberry color with a very thin, pink head that dissipates almost immediately.  Nose full of raspberries.  Nice light mouthfeel, and a tart finish, thats excellent, but not as good as the Belgian Red.

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2008 Pours Ruby raspberry with thin pink head.  Mild carbonation, almost feels like this one should sparkle.  Aroma is raspberry and oak.  Flavor is that with no real acidic finish.  An awesome fruit beer.

This poured bright red to purple in color with a bubbly head.  The raspberry is strong in both the nose and palate with nice sweetness but is also quite fresh and tart.  This is very refreshing and a great summertime brew if not the most complex.
I dont really have anything to say about the beer that the title doesnt already say. Its definitely quite sweet, but the tartness, crispness, and dryness keep it delicious.
Bottle. Nose is sweet raspberry jam/jelly, almost sugary. Pours bright red with a patchy head. Flavor is balanced by a light sourness, but the sweetness is hard to get past.
Pours a hazy raspberry red color with no head.  Aroma is raspberry, oak, and a hint of brett.  Flavor is sugary sweet, raspberries, oak, and a sweet sugary finish.

Bottle, the aroma of this beer is just incredible, smells like fresh raspberries. Amazing. Very fruity,syrupy taste and mouthfeel. I liked this beer more than New Glarus Belgian Red. I would buy this again soon. Its an excellent beer to share with a few friends because it is definitely much too sweet to drink alone. Also you will make lots of friends sharing beer like this.
user_location: The World of Beer, Texas, USA

text:
Thick cloudy unfiltered cranberry juice color with pink foam that quickly settles to some small bubbles.

Intense raspberry, cranberry, cherry aroma thats sweet and tangy smelling.

This beer looks and smells like a raspberry vinaigrette, but it tastes more like cranberry juice and cherry wine.  Very intense and concentrated fruit. This is pretty tart, but for how sweet it is Im surprised its rated so highly.

Mildly carbonated, tart acidity feels very juicy.  Pretty drinkable if you dont mind the sweetness.
Rich dark red body with a light red/pink head.  Strong fresh raspberry aroma.  An extremely sweet initial taste followed by very tart aftertaste with a rather abrupt transition between the two.
Smells very good.  Pours dark red. Perfect combination of sweetness and sourness.  Kind of tart and great taste of raspberries.

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2009 Pour is thick and very dark red.  Aroma is extremely strong with mostly raspberry and has a tart finish (I know, original).  Drinking this beer is just like eating raspberries.  This was a delicious drink that should be shared with someone because its a nice thing to do, and also because it is probably too sweet to drink a whole bottle alone.  Really liked this one.  Would buy again.

Thank you After4ever/Tom for this absolutely divine beer. Its deep, dark red with a creamy, pink head. The aroma has wonderful notes of raspberries with the natural berry acidity. The flavour is divine, smooth and nice - just like I imagine that liquid raspberries would be with their own sweetness and sourness. The mouthfeel is semi-oily and it has note that reminds me of hints of raspberry ice cream, whipped cream and fresh butter. Yummi, its nice!

A- Pours a lavender color with a light reddish head which stays quite a while leaving a little bit of lacing.

S- Smell is ridiculously fragrant, raspberry, sweetness and sourness all combined into one.

T- Taste is strong sweet raspberry with a sour afterthought. Could be considered cloying by some but it is perfect as a New Years Eve Night cap.

M- Fairly thick with quite a bit of carbonation.

D- This is definitely less than drinkable because of the extreme sweetness but under the right circumstances I would easily drink a couple champagne flutes of this awesome brew.

huge thanks to bill and wendy for forcing me out the door with this... pours a mahogany reddish brown color with a small light pink head that doesnt last. invigorating fresh raspberry aroma with a touch of added tartness. you can actually smell the seeds in the berries!.... notes of wood, herbs and grass as well. the palate is lightly sweet but certainly leans heavily on tart. sour and sweet.... who would have thought! the flavor is ridiculously good... the epitome of sour raspberry. medium body with a touch of stickiness but the tart brings it back and puckers the mouth a bit..

Bottle very generously given to me by theisti. Thanks a ton for bringing this back from Wisconsin, Tim! Pours a dark raspberry red with a purplish tint, topped with a small pink head that collapses to a few bubbles at the surface. The nose is a straight, effervescent raspberry with a lightly tart finish. Medium-bodied and slick with a tart, slightly acidic and dry finish. Sweet and nicely tart fresh raspberries with a pleasantly dry finish. This is a very good fruit beer. I cant conceive of anyone that likes raspberries not enjoying this beer. Delicious.
Definitely a standout in this category.  Great balance of sweetness and tartness, giving this beer a very full and intense raspberry flavor.  Every time I pour one I want to take a picture of it.
user_location: I F&ckin hate those guys from, Ohio, USA

text: Berry red colored with a think pink head.  Strong aroma of raspberries.  Tastes, holy tart!  Raspberries, sweet start and a semi-sour finish.  Its an excellent beer for what it is, though Im not sure Id want to have that much in one sitting.

Thanks go out to Ughsmash for this wonderful brew
 
The bottle poured into my flute glass produced a quickly dissipating purple head. The body was a murky dark burgundy red 

Aromas of raspberry along with raspberry and did I mention raspberry 

Flavors of raspberry not overly sweet or tart a nice balance the carbonation was enough to clean the tongue and keep it light and drinkable 

It is a dessert brew for sure the drinkability should be taken as such .It is a great way to finish of a great meal.  

 If it was in smaller bottles and more available to me I would love to try experimenting with cooking with this brew

Sampled at Hellbillys tasting.  Thank you Hellbilly!  Pours a cloudy red color with a small fizzy pink head.  Fresh raspberry aroma with a bit of sourness.  Raspberry sweet-tart flavor.  A seriously great blast of raspberry goodness in a bottle!

Sampled via Hellbillys tasting courtesy of Hellbilly via Bockyhorsey...whew!!!  I believe this was my first fruit beer and what an amazing experience it was.  Wish I didnt have to describe it this way but it possessed a beautiful raspberry body with a razor thin rose colored head.  Flavor is fresh picked fruit with just enough sourness to feel it in your throat and jaw.  A bit of a pucker.  Light yet sticky...an incredible beer.

Sampled at the Hellbillys Hellraiser Phoenix tasting (4/13/08).  Bottle courtesy of Hellbilly.  My first fruit beer ever and the first of two on the night.  Pours a nice red color with pinkish head.  The nose  wow  fresh raspberry blast in the face.  Palate combines the taste of sweet ripe raspberries with sour unripe ones for a palate teasing treat.  Thick, palate coating mouth feel.  Incredible beer.
Red with lasting thin head.  Raspberry, sweet-tart aroma.  Raspberry, tang, sweet flavours.  Sour bitter finish.

UPDATED: JUL 25, 2009 750 bottle courtesy of Ughsmash. Thanks! Pours a cloudy dark red with a small red head. Thick lacing. Aroma is raspberries in great quantity, nice and tart. I guess the name is appropriate. Raspberry is so strong in the taste that I cant really detect anything else. Very tart. Nice level of carbonation, good mouthfeel. Mmm...

Both tytoanderso and drewbeerme were kind enough to send 750s of this gem, so I thank them both! Shared with some good friends while watching hoops. A gorgeous pour with a crazy impressive nose - sweet and *fresh* raspberries, with nothing synthetic about it. Fairly lively carbonation here, giving the smooth, velvety body some balance - nothing too sticky or syrupy, in other words. Just the right amount of tartness, too. I want to drink tons of this.

75cl bottle: Many thanks to cgarvieuk for sharing this with me! Ok, I tasted the beer earlier tonight but now as I am typing up my notes Barry White is playing on the radio and it seems to fit the beer perfectly. Pours a rich raspberry red/purple. Hazy (could be from traveling) with a creamy pink head that settles down to a modest crown. Raspberry aroma shoots from the glass instantly filling your nostrils. Raspberry sorbet! In the back is the slightest hint of yeast. Flavor is just layer after layer of every form of raspberry you can imagine. Fresh raspberries, tart raspberries, raspberry coulis and even raspberry meringue. Lacking non-raspberry aromas and flavors. Much sweeter than expected. Almost as if it were back-sweetened. Sweet but thankfully not a fake sweet or raspberry extract. Slight CO2 sting in the back and a bit of yeast. Definitely gets a bit sticky towards the end. Nice beer but 75cl is way too much even for sharing. A bit one dimensional at times.

Bottle from Ughsmash. Smells like a handful of crushed raspberries. Tastes so much of fresh raspberries that I was expecting to find seeds in it. This is a great beer and would be a surefire way to bring some BMC drinking girls over to the dark side.

Bottle at cads dance off shack tasting. Alround rating: Tart, sour lemon, bursting with raspberrys, still loads of sugary sweetness, however would be nice to try the unadulterated beast. Superior to the belgiun red.

UPDATED: OCT 3, 2015 Bottle at Toms Glasgow tasting 2 ... Light hazy bright red ... wonderfully aromatic Raspberry bouquet ... Sharp tart fruity and shit loads of Raspberrys ... ouch its finnish is raspberry raspberry raspberry... There no doubt that this uses real raspberrys not a syrup as the compexity depth of the flavour fully carries all the Nuances of a fresh raspberry  Ok criminally we opened a bottle to share before heading off to kulminator and Didnt finish this. 2 days later had last Third ... WOW in some ways this was better. We opened it unsettled so the 2 days settling despite having been opened was still wonderfully rasperberry.  WOW .... why does this always make me say wow...deep hazy red ... just so rich and raspberry ... alll raspberry and as i said last time real raspberry ... 4.3 ->4.5

Bottle at home ... bright shiny red ... huge sweet raspberry nose... and real raspberry at that ... little sparkle .... juicy fruity ... tart raspberry in finish... long raspberry finish ... very very nice 4.4

bottle hazy red ... some pink head .. sofr fruit .. massive raspberry hit nose ... big zezty tart raspberry ... massive raspberry tart fruit ... oh yeah .. juicy raspberry 4.3

750ml bottle.  I tried this directly after the Belgian Red which in hindsight was not a great idea because it made me compare the two which is not necessary because they both are so good and have their own positive qualities.  Pours a very thick looking, dark beautiful purple color with a purple head.  The appearance of this rocks.  The aroma on this is spectacular, but again I had to compare it to the Belgian Red which was just a tiny bit better smelling.  Still this was just pure, beautiful raspberry, very, very appetizing aroma.  The mouthfeel on this was ahead of the Belgian Red, just obscenely thick and full bodied which I loved, especially with this beer.  The flavor is not quite as complex or tasty but it still is nice.  Certainly the second best fruit beer Ive had and heads above the competition.  This is very close to the Belgian Red for me and if these were available in Ohio I would buy them all the time.

[750 ml] Huge raspberry aroma, slightly tart. Pours a nice dark red color, with a fluffy pinkish head. Flavors are very juicy and full of fruit, but the sweetness seems to be kept in check by the mild tart character. Very well done, overall. A super drinkable fruit beer, with some serious fruit. Outstanding.

Well, Ill say that this is by no means an every day beer, but as a dessert beverage it is absolutely fantastic.  As, such, I am rating this as a dessert drink.The body is a thick looking, dark crimson red.  A spongy, cream colored head is tinted with a pink hue.  The aroma is pure, unadulterated, fresh, sour raspberry puree.  To claim that I can detect anything but that on the nose would be a lie.  The flavor is again, pure, sweet-tart raspberry jam.  The fruit is intensely sweet at times, and mouth puckeringly tart at others.  The mouthfeel is medium-full and sugary.  This is a heavy beer, and not something I would want more than a flute or two of.  Still, in small quantities, this is a really great apertif.

Bottle, 1pint 9oz, from a great trade with akevitt. Hazy, reddish body with a pink head. Theres wild raspberry in the aroma, lots of it, as well as a sugary touch and a wee sour hint. The raspberries dominates the flavor too, in a really pleasant way, and theres also a nice sour and citric touch to it. Medium to full, sticky body and a slightly sour, berry finish. Fruitbeers isnt really my thing, but this is. (080216)
Dark Red Coloring. Small Head. Very excellent Raspberry Taste...not overpowering. Sweet....and tart at the same time...very well balanced. Wonderful Fruit Beer!! Thank you JPDipso!!!

3-4-08 bottle shared with lb4lb thanks to Iowaherkeye 

Dark red maroon color with a light pastel pink head.  Smells just like raspberry sorbet and tastes similar too.  Taste is so similar to a raspberry juice concentrate that it is difficult to drink large amounts of.  One of the best fruit beers I have tried and normally I cant stand fruit beers at all.  Tart, but still too sweet at the same time.  Can cause a tummy ache - beware.

Bottle from trade with kmeves.  Deep red color, almost a merlot color.  Nice thin head and AWESOME aroma.  I am not a lambic fan, but this one worked for me.  Nice tart fruit flavor with a sticky mouthfeel.  Enough carbonation to make it not a juice/nectar taste.  Nice framboise.  (It also mixes nicely with the ST Choklat.)
Bottle, via trade with HogTownHarry. Pours a dark red. Raspberry aroma, a little vinuous. Flavor is smooth, sweet raspberries with a touch of sourness, but barely there. A nice beer.

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2008 Bottle:  Courtesy nflmvp.  Again, thanks Steve.  Dense, ruby pour with a medium-sized light pink head.  Nose of ripe raspberries, lemon zest, light malts, cinnamon and yeast.  Damn this stuff is smooth, very full in body.  Sweet and tart raspberries dominate the flavor with the same pie/cobbler-esque notes found in the Belgian Red.  Very well carbonated, smooth as hell and a pleasure to enjoy.  Absolutely amazing lingering finish to this.  Great stuff and I cant wait to get more of it.

Bottle.  Pours reddish brown with a pink head.  Aroma is straight raspberries, Im thinking Kool-Aid.  Taste is mostly raspberries, kind of like a raspberry jolly rancher, but slight oak and grain in the finish.  Nice tartness and sweetness.  Decent carbonation.  Not bad, especially since raspberry is my favorite berry.

Thanks to Eben for this one.  Deep purple color.  A small light purple creamy head quickly fades and the bubbles streak the glass.  Aroma is mostly tart, fruity raspberry.  Raspberry sweet tart candy like flavor is dry.  Spritzy, champagne like body.  Delicious.

Bottle courtesy of Iowaherkeye.  Thanks!  Pours a rich dense and hazy blood red with a lasting pinkish hued head in a flute-like glass.  Smell is strong sour raspberries and sugar, and somewhat jam like.  Taste is intensely sweet and almost as tart in the mouth.  Very fruity, and drinks more like a thick raspberry soda or alcopop than beer, but still has elements of malted grains behind the huge raspberry sweetness.  Strong flavor, and syrupy, but the mild mouth puckering tartness helped balance it out enough for me to really enjoy a couple glasses.  Still easily one of the sweetest beers Ive had, but I tend not to mind that too much.

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2008 Tasted at the 3rd Annual Woodshop Tasting. Thanks to cquiroga and company for throwing this epic session together. Very still, silky burgundy color that pours thick and syrupy. Absolutely amazing aroma of raspberry jam and fruity liqueurs, with some toasty wheat notes. Flavor follows up just as good, with more raspberry and strawberries, and a touch of grassy hay. A bit of grains on the finish, with a superb silky mouth feel. This is like a breakfast treat of toast and jelly. Nice!

750 ml bottle courtesy of mgumby10 -- thanks! Ive wanted to try this one for a long time.

Pours a murky red-brown with a modest pink cream head. Aroma of raspberries, raspberries, raspberries, and yogurt cultures. Powerful raspberry flavors, quite sweet and very tart at the same time, some vinegar, raspberry jam, mild caramel as it warms.  

Im having a love-hate thing with this one, and it fluctuates wildly from one extreme to the other with each sip. I have no idea how to rate it. Its too sweet, to over-the-top fruity; but its so great because the raspberries are so intense; and so on...
Muddy, ruby brown.  Giant sour raspberry aroma with some old boot notes!  Delicious fruity sour concoction, rich and filled with fruit...soda like but fancy.  A great beverage!!

A thick, murky  ruby-red pour. Pinkish-red foam. Smells like your favorite raspberry jam withouth any annoying sweetness. Taste is fresh, crushed raspberries, nothing less!
Juicy texture. Healthy body. Not very beerish, but extremely easy to like. (Thanks to Yngwie for sharing this beauty)
Seems more like soda than beer, but it is very tasty and tart like the name says.  I tried this with my wife, and she liked how fruity it tasted.

Bottle at the Laid Back Brussels Tasting (Feb 9, 2008) Red/brown/pink muddy body.  Pinkish, creamy head which diminishes fastly.  Aroma full of raspberries with some cognac, wood, ... Nice but that complex.  Moderately sweet, lightly bitter flavour.  Very sweet finish.  Not very complex.  Not bad, but way to sweet for me.  The raspberries dominate everything.  I think this is a nice beer mixed with a lot of raspberries.  I think it is waste of the beer, as right now the raspberries dominate everything.  It is not like a fruit lambic where the lambic plays a crucial part in the fruit beer.

Bottle shared by yngwie.
Tons of raspberry aroma, the flavour is totally dominated by the berries. A lovely interplay between sourness and sweetness. (But is it a beer?)

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2008 Pours a deep blood red with a large red head.  Huge raspberry aroma.  Flavor is tart raspberry,  some malt,  other dark fruit,  more raspberry.  Sour finish,  decent carbonation.  This beer is great for sharing as an after dinner desert.  Very interesting.  I always find the top half of the bottle to be much more tart,  and the lower half to be a bit sweeter.  Seems like each glass is like that as well.  I pour and share according to peoples taste.  A bit of age takes some edge off of the sweet as well.

750 ml bottle. Pours a deep dark purpleish/brown with a large light lavender head. Aroma of fresh raspberries and a slight touch of wheat. Sour tart flavor of raspberries dominates this one. Serve this with some nice chocolate for the perfect dessert.

Sample at the Super Terrific Stout Tasting on Feb 16th. This beer pours a deep ruby color with a medium and craggy white head that dissipates slowly. Thin rings of lacing on the glass. Nice bouquet of raspberries in the nose with a touch of sweet malt in the background. Medium-bodied with a juicy mouthfeel and tart raspberry (go figure) character. Touches of malt and dark cherry flavor as well. The finish is lively and fruity with an underlying sweetness. New Glarus has found the secret to making Fruit Beers that I enjoy, which is no easy feat. Very good overall.

pours a bubbly red with sweet rasberry aroma.  sweet tart fruitiness and a spritzy mothfeel.  very similar to the Belgian red but more tartness from the rasberrys.  Very good fun drink, definitly sweet desert style beer, but great to drink.

Bottle shared by EDA.  Poured very red with slight pink head.  The aroma was mostly raspberries, and a lot of sweetness.  Flavor was also full of sweet raspberries with a little bit of tartness.  Although I usually like my fruit beers a little more tart, I really enjoyed the taste of real raspberries.

Big, fat, real raspberry nose. Not much else, just loads of fresh berry aromatics. Flavor is sweet but incredibly juicy, slightly tart but very sweet--not quite cloying. This is dessert. Thats not a bad thing.
A tasting at Three Cellars.  VERY sweet !! like drinking candy. No taste of beer at all. If it wasnt for the beautiful woman pouring it it would have been a waste.

Courtesy of toncatcher who opened this gem at the fordest tasting sharing it with fordest, padrefan98, wetherel and of course toncatcher. Pours deep red cut with amber. The head is white with pink-ish hues. Nice big aroma of fresh raspberries. Seems like a bowl full of fresh raspberry puree jam or something that should be added to a peanut butter sandwich. The taste begins with tart and sweet raspberry fruit. Wow, tastes like the raspberries were just picked with rich sweetness and tartness all at the same time. This is smooth delicious and refreshing.

Bottle, thanks to EDA.  Cloudy dark red / brownish pour.  Aroma is fresh raspberries, like raspberry jelly.  Very sweet and delicious smelling.  Flavor is tart raspberry, and some sweet jam also.  Just very tasty, and a great finish to the night.
Wow. What an incredibly appropriate name. It is both raspberry AND tart. Very much so. Very much a lambic character going on. I like it.

Bouteille 750ml, courtoisie de Hogtownharry. De couleur rubis foncée et voilée. Nez très fruité légèrement aigre et sucré (framboises naturelles et en  confitures, traces de pommes cidreuses) avec de faibles notes boisées. Ronde-moyenne en bouche avec un pétillement bas mais croustillant (rappelant un cidre ou un champagne) et une texture sirupeuse fruité. Goût fruité  sucré et légèrement aigre (framboises naturelles et rappelant la confiture, notes de pommes cidreuses, traces de citron) avec quelques traces de vanille lors de lentrée en bouche suivi dun goût progressivement plus aigre de framboises aisni quun arrière-goût moyennement sucré de sirop de framboises (tout en évitant tout goût artificiel) tout au long de la gorgée et ce, jusquen finale, légèrement asséchante et aux petites notes boisées. Post-goût long et un peu sec, aigre de fruits (framboises sucrées) avec de faibles notes de pelures de pommes.

750ml bottle. Aroma features undeniably huge amounts of raspberry character, tart, fresh and juicy with background notes of whole grain toast and faint spices. Also looks like a glass of raspberry juice, thoroughly opaque purplish-red in color with a very minimal head. Flavor is also fully raspberry-oriented, starting sweet and sugary and turning quite a bit more tart by the finish, which is long, lingering and still packing an incredible amount of fresh raspberry flavor and much lighter suggestions of wood, wheat citrus and buttery pastry. Mouthfeel is lightly acidic and quite lively with a light body to match. Certainly is about the most overt raspberry character one is likely to find in a beer. Nevertheless, it works quite well due to the interplay of tart and sweet, along with the gently balancing malts.

Poured into a wine tulip. Color is an extremely dark shade of burgundy. The opaque body rests beneath a 2 finger head of pinkish tan hue. It leaves some spotty lacing.

Aroma is starkly raspberryish. Literally smells exactly like raspberry preserves.

Taste is also dominated by succulent raspberry. It carries a sharp raspberry seed tanginess that serves to balance the sweetness. This tart note is cheek puckering and quite enjoyable. Theres a fleeting tootsie pop note in the finish as well.

Body is quite full, making this an epic dessert beer. The carbonation helps carry the balancing tartness through the palate. A delightful beer thats really easy to drink.

Giant thanks to Hogtownharry for this!  Muddy ruby, very thin head.  Nose is big raspberry, malt, earthy pits, cherry juice.  Flavor is raspberry & cherry juice, earthy and a hint of wood.  Light tartness/acidity is balanced by fruity sweetness.  Really nice stuff.

Bottle.  Pours a beautiful Red, with a light pink light head that dissipates quickly.  Aroma...  Raspberries and Vanilla Cream.  Reminds of of Respberry Tarts, as the name suggests.  Flavor is great!  Think Raspberry Tart, and bottle it!  Raspberry to start, with the creamy vanilla to mellow, then towards the end turning into a bit of a tart raspberry flavor.  Its light and smooth on the palate.  Glides down so easy you could finish the bottle before you knew it.  I would recommend this to ANYONE...  Excellent Pick for My #100.  I wanted something special and I got it.

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2010 Bottle - shared with HogTownHarry; Wonderful robust raspberry aroma. Flavour; Really tart flavour; incredibly so; wow - like drinking a glass of fresh raspberries, has to be tasted to be believed

Pours a reddish brown color with a small head. Huge aromas of tart raspberries.Flavor reminds me of raspberry pancake syrup! Great mouth puckering tart finish. Wonderful Stuff! Thanks alot for sharing this one Ubamartian!

Aroma is an amazing fresh raspberry scent.  Color is a deep solid brownish red with very low carbonation and thin head.  Taste is tart and fruity.  It starts with a medium body that goes down crisp with a tangy feel.  Finish comes in with a very tart and bold raspberry flavor and ends with a sour bite.  This is the most incredible Framboise I have ever had and just one of the best brews made in the world.

Foam Rangers January meeting. What can I say about this beer. Pours a red raspberry color with small fizzy head. Raspberries all over the place with a nice crisp citrus flavor for added measure. This was fantastic when mixed with several different kinds of Impy Stouts.

750, thanks to after4ever! Pours hazy red-amber with a fading pink head. Medium-light body and light carbonation. Big nose of fresh raspberries. Sweet-tart lemony raspberry taste. Crisp finish with a bit of vinegar on the exit.
This was delicious and a great beer to drink at dinner or  holidays,sweet,creamy and a little tart but very enjoyable to drink anytime.CHEERS!

750, capped and waxed. Thanks, Facto! This probably has a year on it at this point. Pours crystal clear but very dark amber with gorgeous ruby highlights. Crimson shows on the body on the pour (narrower stream). Dense moussy pink head that falls quickly away to a slim rim. Huge bright fruity sweet raspberry nose. Soft, velvety, thick, and creamy body. Very soft carb. Rich tart razz all over the mid-palate; booze is totally hidden so its almost like slightly underdiluted fruit juice. Long sweet sticky finish. Frickin awesome.
Bottle.  Aroma of sour raspberries, very surprised by the aroma, youd think it was a s our beer by the aroma.  Pours a cloudy red with a pinkish head.  Flavors of sweet raspberries.
Jan. 2006 - This is the same beer as the Belgian Red, but only with raspberry flavor instead of cherry. So, Ill rate them the same, except 0.1 less, cuz I like the cherry flavor better.
As advertised, like a glass of raspberry tart.  The hints of spice in the flavor are quite nice.

Bottle from pepsican. Aroma of raspberry jam. Fresh raspberries all over the place. Pours a dark red with a pinkish head. Flavor of sweet fresh raspberries. Jam, puree, whatever. Followed by an intensely tart bite. Finishes mouth puckeringly tart/dry. Basically, this is amazing! Give me more!

I might sound a bit like a broken record whenever I rate New Glarus beers, but they are so incredibly well made and so damned tasty its hard not to rave about them. Ive been storing a bottle of the Raspberry Tart for over a year now and thought Christmas Eve would be a great time to break it out and share it with the family. The beer pours out a foamy, carbonated red color, large and small bubbles throughout like a champagne. Head is a soft pink in color. Aroma is like a bowl of fresh raspberries and a bit of toasted pie crust. Flavor just pulsates with raspberry fruitiness. An incredible balance between sweet and tart. Ive been lucky enought to try some top notch fruit beers recently and this ranks up there right with em. Excellent beer.

Fired down just before Xmas. Lots and lots of raspberries, as you would assume. Not overally sour, but just enough to get ya to pucker up a bit. This and the Belgian Red are both top notch in small doses.

Pours a cranberry/raspberry crimson with a big frothy pink highlighted head that forms in cascading fashion and dies slow with lacing. Smells of juicy, ripe, delicious raspberries! Taste as it smells. Really nothing to say other than someone took some of the best raspberries, squeezed the juice out of them and somehow hid some alcohol in there. Makes you pucker in delight! I love sour stuff, I love beer, I love this beer. Thicker than I thought it would be in the mouth without much carbonation. An absolute delight, but drinkability is limited to being full, such as drinking a bunch of cranberry juice. Definitly worth a try.

750 ml bottle from the UGHHHHHH!  Took me a long while to crack this guy.  For whatever reason, I found myself eating some dried cherries - and this brew popped into my mind.  Perfect timing.  Smooth, elegant, and engaging aroma of vanilla ice cream smothered in oak wrapped raspberries.  My favorite part of the brew.  flavor quite similar with the non-funky tart addition and lingering finish.  Appearance resembled a cola type beverage.  Palate was nice but became a bit off and cloying.  Loaded with flavor considering the ABV.  Overall, enjoyable and intriguing...but was difficult to drink the whole bottle to myself - should have shared the guy 2-3 ways for sure.  Thanks J!

Bottle.   Pours ared tinted hazy brown color with a decent rocky pinkish-tan clored head.   Huge aroma of tart raspberries, vanilla, oak, some citrus.   Flavor is heavenly raspberry pie, vanilla, oak.   Palate is medium bodied, medium to high carbonation, finishes tart.   Outstanding.

Thick murky pour of brown with a decidedly red tinge to it, accompanied by the expected pink head. Falls quickly.
Fantastic aroma of fresh raspberries.
The flavor is that of more raspberries.

bottle, from Brigadier (unsolicited) Thanks!!!! 

Wow, just fantastic aroma of raspberries hits you upon opening the bottle, then out pours an amazing colored liquid furthering the bouquet of raspberries,... tart but not sour, sweet but not sticky.. just fantastic, no downfall here, darn close to a perfect beer.
This is a winner. Not too cute or sweet. Wonderful natural taste. Does not taste like an additive was used. Refreshing from beginning to end. Only negative - one of these is enough.

This beer is fantastic.  Split a bottle at a family gathering.  Smells good, tastes even better.  Incredibly heavy on the raspberries.  My favorite raspberry beer.  Incredibly sweet, but it is actually a little tart as well.  Nicely done.

Pours a deep ruby color, light head, which is also pink.  Three words can sum up this beer: raspberry, raspberry, raspberry.  Definite tartness as well, slight acidity, no hop or malt flavor.  Hard to think of this as a "beer", but delicious nonetheless.

Pours a beatiful ruby red  color, with a craggy and rich head, that seemingly vanishes in a blink of an eye.  Aroma is raspberry jam, fresh cherries, a slight almond note. perhaps even some vanilla and wood.  Flavor is full on raspberry sweetness, tempered ever so nicely with a wonderful tart acidity.  New Glarus never ceases to amaze me.
WOW! pours dark red,with a rasberry head,full fruit fillrd nose.sweet ciderlike tases sharp twang at the end,unbelievible beer.word do not do it justice!

25 oz. bottle, consumed on Thanksgiving (11-22-07). Raspberry fills the aroma, not to my surprise. Sugar candy as well. The aroma reminds me of the smell of fresh raspberries from my raspberry patch in the summer with powdered sugar sprinkled on top (Mmm Ill have to try that!). Also smells of sweet baked goods, like raspberry pie or raspberry Pop Tarts. There is a noticeable tanginess to the smell, but the sugary fruit sweetness is most pronounced. Very little traditional beer smell. Pours a ruby dark brown with a moderate amount of thin, short-lasting, pinkish gray/tan head. Appears at first to be opaque, but it is in fact clear. Sour and tangy flavors. Its decidedly on the sour side for a fruit beer. Yes, it tastes of raspberries, but with the sweetness turned down low and the tartness cranked up to 11. In fact, its one of the more sour beers Ive ever had. Rhubarb pie notes. The wheat malt taste is well-hidden but did emerge to a small degree after I got over the initial fruit-sour shock. Medium body. Lively in the palate. The tartness makes it tangy in the throat. Very cool palate sensations, but it is a tad too harsh to earn a perfect palate score. Raspberry Tart is a very different sort of beer. Its quite enjoyable, but its hard for me to rate because it is so different. It smells so sweet and it tastes so sour. Its not at all what I expected, especially in the flavors, but that doesnt mean I didnt like it.

Pours a hazy brownish red with a sparseish pink tan head.  Very sweet raspberry.  Not too sharp in terms of fruit.  Extremely round in terms of caramel aspect to the malt.  Even perhaps a bit of leather.  A little salty.  A little honey.  Subtle carbonation, soft body.  Not at all watery still.  Big and sweet with huge fruit.  A bit oaky and a bit dusty, slightly tannic.  A little bit of a yogurty bite.  Again, a little leathery.  Not cloying, but still very sweet.  A bit of honey and raspberry tartness in the finish.  A lovely beer, reminds me of Redbach, but much better.

Thanx to Fantomas for this.Wow what a color, almost to pretty to drink.Poured a crimson red with no head.Lots of berrys on the nose with some sweetness.Taste was well balanced of sweetness to tartness with lots of raspberries running around.Finish was tart and sticky.

750ml bottle: Deep red/purple body with a light purple-tinged head that diminishes quickly. The aroma is almost all raspberry, as you might suspect if youve had New Glarus Belgian Red. There are some notes of bready malts to remind you very subtlely that this is a beer and not fruit juice. The flavor is heavily sweet and heavily tart. Lots of acidity. The medium body has a sticky, dry, tart finish. Enjoyable, but a little goes a long way.

750 ml bottle
Appearance: 3 Purple, hazy with pink head
Aroma: 9 Intense raspberry with jammy notes.  Some horsey aromas, no hop character
Flavor: 9  Slightly sour with raspberry throughout.  Tart finish (sweet-tart / brettanomyces).  
Palate: 3 Med body, hi carbonation - prickly
Overall: 19  Wow! very nice with intense fruitiness and nice sour finish with a sweet start.  Great stuff.  Brought home to CO via a very carefully packed checked bag.

750ml bottle: Pours ruby red with a thick, purple head that fizzles away in minutes.  The aroma is thick with fruit - ranging from Jolly Rancher sweetness to raspberry and cream daquiri creaminess to sour raspberries right from the vine.  Its really quite complex considering it really comes down to one dimension.  My cheeks were automatically inverted as I took my first sip and the intense tartness hit my mouth.  Wow - this is tart and sour and mouth puckering.  My taste buds adjusted (slightly) as I drink more, but this is much more sour that I expected.  The mouthfeel remains creamy.  As the initial blast of tart resides, the wheaty and bready body reveals itself, briefly, until the sourness hits the back of the tongue on the way down.  The finish leaves a wider variety of fruit notes on the tongue - I am getting strawberry and cherry in addition to the razz.  This is interesting stuff - definitely for sipping and would be great with a cheesecake or other super sweet dessert.  Today, a really sharp cheddar is helping to cut through the intense tartness nicely.

bottle from buckybeer big thanks:
pours an extremely dark red with a few brown hints. the head is a cocoa pink.
aroma is a very sweet fresh raspberry that is simply wonderful. there is a tartness like cheery that is also great. i get a very small amount of the sweet malts in the background.
i can not believe this is a beer what a wonderful rspberry flavour with great tartness that is also sweet in the start. this is almost like drinking fresh raspberry juice. just fantastic.
bottle.  puree rasp pour.  fresh off the vine raspberry with some sugar in aroma.  absolutely delicious.  pure fruit.  alcohol hidden.  great.

I dont believe I only got one bottle of this when I was at the brewery. I should have just sucked it up and bought the case.

Pours out with a moderate carbonation and a nice crisp head. Smells of Raspberrys to the point that you think it is going to be overly sweet and syrupy. Quite to the contrary, it has a beautiful slightly sour flavor with a well balanced raspberry flavor that leaves you wanting to drink more of this lovely elixir.

750ml bottle. Just like the Belgian Red, this smacks you in the face with its fruitiness. The aroma is raspberries, the taste is raspberries, everything is raspberries. It pours a nice bright red with a pink head. Very highly carbonated. A nice tarty flavor with a clean finish. It is sweet and that gets you after the second or third glass. Its best to have a group of people around when drinking a bottle.

[Bottle] Pours red with a nice big pink head.  Aroma is an intense blast of raspberries.  Taste is the same--fresh, tart raspberries.  Fairly thick.  Good finish.  Had the Belgian Red right before this, which was a mistake because although this is outstanding, it cant quite measure up to the red.
Next to their belgium cherry beer, this is the best fruit beer there is.  Deep color, thin reddish pink head, juicy and fresh raspberry taste. Tart and simple.

Dark ruby color with a small pink head.  Aroma is a very intense raspberry blast that is very lively.  Taste is intense with a powerfully tart raspberry flavor that climbs rapidly up the tongue.  Nice tingly feel with just the right amount of carbonation.  I still prefer the Belgian Red, but only due to my love of Cherries - Great brew!

Pours a beautiful bright red like cranberry juice. Awesome fresh juicy rasberry aroma. If i wasnt looking i would think i was smelling a bowl of fresh picked ones. Flavor is supremely fresh fruit and lots of tartness, almost enough to make you pucker. Body is light but not thin. Not much else to say about this beer, there is only a few things to this beer, but it does them unbelievably well.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2009 750ml Bottle:  Very sweet aroma.  Smells of raspberries and Robitussin.  Poured ruby/magenta in color with a small, fizzy, tan/pink head that diminished immediately.  Flavor is medium sweet and medium tart.  Tastes of raspberries.  Medium body.  Thin, but tingly, texture.  Lively carbonation.  Sweet and tart raspberry finish.  Overall, a very good fruit beer.

Bottle. Thanks to Stine for sending me this. Pours a deep red body with nice thin head. Pleasant aroma of raspberries. Flavor was thick with a nice raspberry syrupy taste, some chocolate. I was sad to see this bottle end so fast.

(750ml bottle) Sampled at the Post-Great Canadian Beer Festival 2007 in Victoria on September 8th, 2007. Courtesy of Ungsmash trade. Deep purple body. Nose of wild seedy raspberry. Flavour is unbalanced - sweet and tart tongue. Beautifully raw, fine raspberry palate with a tart rampage. Easily my favourite beer of Festival weekend.

Bad Mutha Pucker!  This is something you spread around to guests.  A little too sour to have more that a small glass.  It is thick opaque red in the glass, and feels as thick on the tongue.  I really different beer.

Pours a very cool dark ruby red with a pink tinged one finger head. The head fades fairly quickly to a thin swirling cap and ring, leaving behind a thin wispy lace.

Smell; theres a huge tart raspberry aroma, which is no surprise, but theres also a bit of a sweet sugary presence underneath that. Otherwise theres not much else going on in the aroma department.

Taste; as with the nose, and to be expected, theres big tart raspberry flavor. A little bit of some sweetness come through the tartness, as well as a mild hint of some caramel and cherries. The sweet and tart flavors seem to flow back and forth very nicely, and make this probably the best fruit beer that Ive had so far.

Mouthfeel is full bodied, and leaves a thick coating in my mouth after each sip, and the drinkability is really good, as the beer is just disappearing before my eyes.
user_location: Where the hell am I?, Nebraska, USA

text: Bottle.  Aroma is full of raspberries and tart.  Extremely well balanced.  Like the belgian red, but much fruitier and tartier.  Phenomenal beer.

Bottle.  I wasnt necessarily prepared for a fruit beer when I had this, but I can still appreciate it.  Huge and balanced aroma.  Like the belgian red but fruitier, if thats possible.  Definitely worth having.

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2007 Bottle from Capones.  I was a big fan of the Belgian Red, but this Raspberry Tart may have 1 upped it.  Im typically not a big fan of sweet beers, but I just love how it was balanced.  Its not Cantillon tart, but still I applaud New Glarus for stepping out of the box on this one. Good for dessert.

Bottle from Capones.  Definite rasberry\fruity aroma pours like rasberry soda and looks a little like a wine. Very sugary ,tart and alhocohol flavor. It was good but got annoying after first glass. Not a bad beer but different.

Bottle from Styles tried with my friend Tete.  Pours like melted raspberry jam.  Thick, cloudy.  Small head, but nice microbubble lacing.  Nice raspberry aroma.  Sweet.  Good medium level of carbonation.  Not as tart as the name implies, at a perfect level.  A little on the sweet side, and this is coming from someone who loves sweet, so it reduces its drinkability.

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2007 Date: 06/18/2005
Mode: Bottle
Source: Tasting, Noog I

opaque purple, frothy pink head, 
huge sweet raspberry aroma, velvet raspberry cream body, 
huge raspberry flavor, just a nip of tartness, 
-------- />
Date: 10/10/2007
Mode: bottle
Words: Logans Pre-GABF Tasting

lots of tartness in the rich raspberry aroma along with the raspberry candy sweetness, 
rich raspberry flavor, sweet and tart are in perfect balance, 

Aroma: 8/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 8/10; Overall: 16/20
Rating: 3.8/5.0Drinkability: 8/10
Score: **4

UPDATED: APR 9, 2008 Smells like a freshly picked batch of raspberries. And, surprise, surprise, it tastes like one too. Has a sharp tartness that is really enjoyable and the bubbly nature of the beer is a good contrast to the sourness. Another awesome one by New Glarus.

An amazing raspberry aroma that is so much like very ripe raspberries that it makes your mouth water. A tartness in the aroma that makes it water even more. A slightly hazed red/amber pour with almost no head and a hint of whitish lace. The tart raspberry flavor will make your tongue roll up and if you dont pucker you aint a puckerer. The flavor is clean and just grinds at your buds. Excellent carbonation that is just enough to make it enjoyable. The palate is just a very very tad thin but damn close to perfect. Overall if you dont like this beer your not alive. I continue to be amazed at NGs ability to push the limit on their beers. Damn fine.

Bottle courtesy of HogTown Harry. Deep raspberry nose with deep red color with medium pinkish head. Much more tart than the Belgian Red. Huge framboise flvor. Enjoyed this more & more as it warmed up. Very drinkable & very good

Bottle, courtesy of nflmvp, thanks Steve!  Pours a plummish color with a nice pinkish white head that drifts to a ring, minimal lacing.  As expected, aroma is raspberries, and boy do they smell good!  Flavor pulls it off nicely, with just enough tartness and sweet without being overdone.  Palate is also very complimentary for this style, clean, crisp and lighter with moderate carbonation.  Wow, does NG sure know how to do the fruit beers, and this is the perfect elixir for a hot, muggy summer night!

Bottled (thanks Ruth!). Dark murky red colour with mediumsized pink head. Aroma is nice raspberries with some slight sourness. Flavour is sour raspberries along with some vanilla. Very mouthdrying. Some slight nutty hints in the finish. Really nicely done sour fruitbeer.

Bottle @ Chris_o shindig 2007. Deep red color with a average, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, light red head. Aroma is moderate to heavy raspberry. Flavor is moderate sweet and light acidic, with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft.

Bottle trade from shigadeyo. Poured raspbeery color with a small head that diminished quickly with minimal lacing. Heavy raspberry aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture. Strong tart raspberry flavor with a sweet long finish.  My expectations where not met.

I dont drink a lot of lambic. Too sweet for my taste---and I do have a sweet tooth. But this may change that! Very sweet, but not too much. But very, very good.

This pours with an intense red color, strawberry lace, and raspberry aroma. As one other reviewer noted, it is so focused on the raspberries, that it is hard to write much. BUT that focus doesnt detract from the flavor.
Bottle Chris_o Shindig.  Nice pippy raspberry aroma.  Bit of mustiness, but lovely fruit, lots of sour raspberry.  Thats pretty good.  Good jammy beer.  Sweet and sickly after a while maybe.

A Mes rate: 
Bottle at Chris Os Shindig. Dark, dark raspberry coloured. Pithy, tarty and sweet aroma. Nice enough but just too sweet for me. Flavour is more of the same. Nothing much to shout about except for some very lovely thick and tart raspberry juice. Mouthfeel is wonderful and creamy and lines the mouth with a sweetness that lingers briefly, then just seems to vanish, leaving you smacking your lips wanting more. The palate is the best thing about it for me. I wanted to try this for a long long time and if I am honest, although it is undoubtedly good, I did expect it to be better.

Bottle, chris_o shindig. Ruby - copper colour with a thin off-white head. Nose is sweet raspberry, malt, red wine vinegar, mouth is not too sour, not too sweet. Little sour, balances out with the sweet though. Sourness struggles through to the end. Balanced with that sweetness all the way. Very good.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2009 Cloudy dark-red body topped by a little pink ring of foam.  Fresh raspberries on the nose.  Intense raspberries concentrate taste.  Pure raspberries sourness and tartness with only a little raspberries natural sweetness, no added sugar.  Too intense to be drank quickly.  4% sipper.  In a way it is very one-dimensional focussing sorely on raspberries but on the other hand it feels so complete and complex.  In fact it is so focussed on raspberries that it is hard to write a long text to describe it.  And Im not the type of guy who will write a long rating just for the sake of writing a long rating.  I will not write sentences that do not add anything just to make the rating longer.  Nor will I throw in a sentence that could easily be taken out without affecting the actual content of the rating.  Im not one of those guys that go on an on with a long rating for nothing, using synonyms, equivalent words, interchangeable words or words that have the same meaning.  I will not deviate from the subject either like this rating I read the day my cousin Louis got married.  I still cant believe that my stupid ugly cousin Louis found himself a wife.  Although if youd see his wife youd understand.  No sir, Im the type of guy who goes straight to the point, no beating around the bush with me, the lesser the better, short and accurate is my moto.

Thin purplish head. Purple haze body. Intense raspberry aroma with blackberry notes. No beating about the bush here. Raspberry. And lots of it. Pure fruit aroma, nothing else. Intense sharp raspberry taste with, again, notes of blackberry. Kind of tart, unsurprisingly. Aftertaste is the same. Excellent! (0.65l bottle from MartinT.)

When I smelled the aroma I thought. Oh no, just another fruit beer that smells a little better because it really is nothing else but pure raspberry juice. Appearance was ok though, deep red, pink head, good lace. But after that ... the flavors and mouthfeel are really perfect for a fruity beer. I couldnt think of anything else to be there. Wonderful.
Wow!  NG knows how to make a lambic-style beer, and this is the best!  Tart raspberry aroma and flavor, and unlike 99% of other fruit beers its not too sweet.  Nice beer for chocolatey desserts.
This is similar to the beligian red (darker almost purple) but the raspberries give it quite a bit more tart bite to it with a nice raspberry aroma.  Another excellent one from New Glarus.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2012 Muddy red with a light red head. Raspberry juice aroma, fresh and very natural, with the tiniest hints of funk along with caramel and toffee, almost creme brulee like. Flavour is of sweet raspberry and it is slightly tart (surprise!).  A very pleasant drink, extremely drinkable despite the thickness, and cleaning the palate in a wonderful way.

Pours a dark red color with a pink head.  Aroma is pretty much just raspberries.  Flavor is also pretty much just raspberries.  Pretty thick on the palate with a decent tart finish.  Another great beer from New Glarus.

Served out of a bomber on New Years Eve into a champagne flute. Pours out a beautiful rich red with a pink head. Smell - WOW. What a nose of raspberry! That nose continues into a kick ass blast of raspberry in the taste. Tart, and sour and sweet at the same time. Medium level of carbonation. I dont think they could have nailed it any better for the style. I poured a flute for the wife as well to celebrate the night. It was wasted on her as she just couldnt handle the taste. Very surprising and disapointing, but what are you going to do? For a woman thats been fed Surly Furious, Hop Slam and Stone Ruination, youd think she would appreciate the tartness for what it is. No matter, more for me. I wish there was someone else in the house I could share this with. I wont chance corking and trying tomorrow- I will just have to bite the bullet and finish myself. I am enjoying this much more than the belgian red, but I think thats just because I like raspberries over cherries.
Pours dark red, light pink head. Aroma is raspberries. Thicker mouth feel with a strong raspberry flavor and a dry, tart finish.

750ml Bottle pours out a dark red topped with a light pink head. A nice aroma of berries. Great tast with some very nice tart at the end pretty good stuff. Not as good as the cherry but still good. Thanks Footbalm for this one.

Pour is a nice bright red with a pink head.  Aroma is outstanding.   No need bringing the glass to your nose you can smell the raspberrys from across the room.  Flavor is of course more raspberrys with a super sweet-tart pucker.  Super fresh tasting fruit beer.

Wow, a deep raspberry aroma.  All raspberry.  It does not have anything else in the aroma, at least to my weak nostrils.  Taste follows suit for the most part with an ending sourness.  Just really good, yummy stuff.

Glub glub glub, out it comes, slowly. Dark red body, obviously thick and sticky as soon as it hits the glass and sticks to whatever surface it touches. A very small off-white head with orange and pink hues fades to a ring of fat bubbles nearly instantaneously. The aroma is as close to raspberry preserves as the real thing. No hints of alcohol, no medicinal notes, just big, fat, exploding raspberries. The flavor is incredibly sweet and very lightly tart, with no bitterness and a hint of acidity. The finish is lightly tart, all raspberry and modest in length for such powerful beginnings. The mouthfeel is absurdly thick and certainly unfiltered, leaving bits of raspberry seeds stuck between the teeth. Massive full body, light fizzy carbonation.
A beer that excels at excess. This is the thickest beer I have ever had. I could repeat this statement fifty times and not get my feelings across adequately. What a monstrous mouthfeel. Really fun to drink.

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2008 Oh my god, what a joy.  Pours a dark red/purple color.  Taste is very tart and a bit sour with a perfect flavor of raspberries.  I saw the vats that this is made in and was told that a pound of fruit goes into every bottle.  Pure beer magic!

12 ounce bottle. Fluted type glass. Deep reddish amber with, get this, a pink head. Aroma was all raspberry. No surprises here. The flavor was very tart and very raspberry with a touch of sourness. This one was more like a sparkling wine or wine cooler than a beer. Very nice for what it is, although it does not live up to New Glarus Belgian Red.

Brick red with redish white small head.  Nose is all raspberry.  Flavor is raspberry up front with a nice mouthfeel.  Finish is acidic, almost tomato juice like, with the acid from the berries.  Beautiful beer in this one.
Poured ruby red with little head. Aroma of raspberries. Full of raspberry flavor with strong carbonation. Very smoothe and refreshing.

Bottle from some kind bastard I cant remember? Dark red("raspberry red"!) in color with small light pink head. Fantastic raspberry in the aroma and taste. Just damn good. Pretty damn sweet. Actually fairly thick and syrupy compared to what I expected. Perfect with good dark chocolate.

Bottle thanks to pantanap.  Dark red body with white, pinkish-hued head.  Wonderfully blended aroma of sweet and tart raspberries.  Flavor starts out as sweet raspberries but is balanced with a subtle oakiness and finishes with a slightly mouth-puckering tartness.
Cloudy dark ruby color with small head. Strong raspberry aroma. Tatse was like Belgian red only rasperry instead of cherries. prickly carbonation. Good beer, just not as good as Belgian Red.

Bottle thanks to Notalush poured a cloudy pinkish/red color with a tiny pink head. The aroma was huge rasperries with a sour tartness. Flavor was a puckering raspberry with a bit of oak making it highly drinkable. The sour tartness fades as the temp. goes up. Ive got to say this is the best fruit beer hands down. Thanks for sharing.

Chicago Trip. 17:20. Small bottle in the hotel in Madison. Raspberry parfait in a glass. Thick dark pink head on a red beer. At first raspberry jam nose then deeper like cooking raspberries before it gets to be jam. Pure raspberry juice. No alcohol presence. Just fresh raspberry taste. Leaves tart seeds in your teeth. A sipper. 

Had a large bottle back home. A thinner body. More like beer. Even nice when warmed in the microwave.

Shared with presario, Tipsy_Mcstager, and ChineseHercules. Pours a deep murky maroon with a fizzy pink head. The carbonation is champagne-like and tickles your nose as you contemplate the aroma. This smells like youve picked up a handful of fresh raspberries and crushed them in your fist-- fresh, sour, juicy. Pure raspberry juiciness dominates the palate, but it is far from one-dimensional. Several key elements elevate this beer into something unique and special-- a fresh sour-tartness that perfectly balances the fruit juice sweetness; an ephemeral stemmy-leafy quality that imparts both an earthiness and a bitterness that keep this tasting real and not candyish, and most importantly the delicate and lively carbonation keeps it alive on the tongue. This style is hit-and-miss for me, but this is definitely among the finest fruit beers I have ever had, and one that is worth seeking out. I agree with presario that this would be fun to try mulled, and then on another occasion, over ice.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Aroma is pure raspberry tartness. Pours a gorgeous cloudy red-cherry. Pure raspberry sweetness with tartness. Carbonation expands the flavour experience. World class for the style.

A swell fruit beer,still the same as
years ago.The only solution to the
many brews of New Glarus is to
vacation there.The owner is proud
of his brews and it shows when
you see copper kettles polished to
look like solid gold.My memories of
this quaint village will last an eternity.

Deep crimson pour with very minimal head.  Aroma is intense raspberry, but lessens with time...  Very sweet raspberry flavor is not fake in the least...rather it is natural and balanced by a nice, smooth tartness that mellows the initial sugar flavor.  Good, moderate level of carbonation and an extremely pleasant aftertaste...nothing bitter like other fruit beers.  I had high expectations when I picked this one up at the New Glarus brewery in WI, and all expectations were met.  This is the first fruit beer that is not fake in the least, but rather one you can enjoy from first sip to last!

Red body with small pink head.  Aroma is pure raspberries but unlike other fruit beers it begs you to drink it.  Med body with nice carb,  a nice fresh, sweet rasberries taste fills the mouth but is quickly met with a tartness that is unlike most anything youll try.  Perfect with choclate brownies.  I actually prefer this over the Belgium red.
Imagine a fresh jar of Raspberry jam then imagine drinkining it . Deep red very powerfull flavor.Drink it from a flute and share with good friends because i cant imagine drinking it by yourself

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2007 Bottle from Kevin. Pours a muddy plum, with a diminishing tan head. Sour aroma of raspberries, lemon, and yeast. Nice rich, medium mouthfeel with fine carbonation. Initial flavor is sweet with notes of raspberry and rhubarb pie. The middle has some faint oak. Very tart with a subtle touch of hops. The carbonation has a fine spritziness as it goes down. Very nice beer. Drinking a whole bottle by yourself is not easy for me, as this is a bit rich and sweet.  How about putting those is 12 ounce bottles? I still think the Belgian Red is the better of the two.

The raspberry aromas waft up almost as soon as I open this. Smells of sweet raspberry jam, and like some kind of raspberry-lemonade. Pours blood colored with pink lacing. The tartness comes thru more in the taste and quickly follows the sweet raspberry flavor. An effervescent like carbonation, like a sparkling wine, tingles on the tongue and hits in the back of the throat. Not an everyday drinker, this bottle is definitely one I would share, but well balanced flavors and a great experience.

From a 750mL Bottle.  Pours a mostly transparent, deep crimson color with shades of black cherry and a thin layer of foamy ivory head.  Beautiful aroma of freshly picked raspberries, over-ripe and gushing with juice.  Sweet, but authentic and has a subtle seed-like herbal woody quality to it thats quite nice.  Rich raspberries, but not a whole lot of other dimensions.  Medium bodied, sparkling mouthfeel.  Not sticky or cloying, but definitely too sweet for my palate, and gives this beer a bit of a one-dimensional quality.  Lots of sweet raspberries at first, quite delicious, and then the flavors fade to the promise of some cidery funk.  A little bit of woody, funky spice, but not dry enough to enhance this quality fully.  The finish actually reminds me quite a bit of the unplugged enigma, without the raspberry residue of course.  Delicious raspberry aroma and flavor, but the palate could be a bit dryer and funkier to help develop more complexity.  Fantastic beer, but too sweet for my tastes to give a higher overall score.  Definitely worth having on hand to pair with berry desserts in small portions.  Thanks, Tom!
not as good as belgium red. a bit to sweet for my taste but still a nice ale to enjoy.

Bottle: Pours a nice deep ruby/purple topped by a bubbly, khaki-colored head. One of the most purely fruity aromas in beer. Just like a fresh jar of homemade raspberry preserves, straight up! Amazingly fruity flavor as well, almost sorbet like with an acidic hint to balance the fruity viscosity. I was in disbelief that this is only 4% ABV because of the richness in flavor and body. Has a very natural feel, and an almost cleansing/refreshing power. Very interesting and rich fruit beer made for moderation.

Deep garnet coloured beer, thick pink head.  Sweet, juicy, fresh raspberry aroma.  Smells just like a bottle of raspberry jam.  Even the seeds which add a sort of woodiness that is usually missing from syrup-based beers, is present here.  Sweet, fruity flavour with loads of juicy raspberry character, a touch of tartness that really sets off the fruitiness of the beer.  Palate is quite good with the barest hint of maltiness serving as a backing note to the intense fruitiness.  Perhaps the least beer-like beer Ive had to date, reminding me more of some of the raspberry wines and ports that Ive had before.  Warming brings out the malt aspects a bit more than they first appeared.  Great balance and an awesome beer.

Courtesy boboski.  Dark scarlet color with soapy head at the edges.  Aroma is tart and made me think of raspbery seeds.  I guess the smell is that evocative of an actual raspberry.  Super thick palate.  Taste is somewhat acidic to begin, but the sweet/tart finish takes center stage.  Another masterful use of fruit by NG, but I found this something I probably couldnt drink a whole bottle of by myself, whereas I could drink Belgian Red all day long.

Thanks Brandon! deep clear red with a pink head. aroma fresh musky raspberries. very tart raspberry flavor with nice light sweet notes. sweet/tart raspberry finish. medium body. sparkling carbonation. just like the belgian red this beer is straightforward but very nice. just great natural raspberry flavor. well done.

wow...the best raspberry beer out there to date..pours deep red with medium pink head..aroma huge in actual raspberry, not raspberry syrup...a beautiful tart raspberry flavor complements this..somewhat like a framboise lambic in nature, and very similar to the flavor of Lindemans Framboise...excellent!

Bottle sent by captaincougar a while ago. Aroma is of rich raspberries that are richer than raspberry pie. Dark brown with a light pink head. Flavor was really sweet and delicious. I think you could give this to anyone at any age and they would think it tastes good. A nice tart flavor to it. Really good if it was a little less sweet then it would be perfect.

750 ml bottle courtesy of pantanap (thanks!).  Poured a lovely dark red with slight pink head.  Aroma of pure raspberries...yummy.  Taste was all raspberry as well, but with a nice tartness that made me want more.  Finished dry and tangy.  My girlfriend and her mom enjoyed this one quite a bit too. Not much else I can really say about this one.  Thanks a lot for the bottle Kan!

This has a beautiful thick purple tone.  Very thick palate.  It has a very strong raspberry flavor.  This is a wonderful beer- awesome appearance, raspberry aroma and flavor.  I hope to enjoy this beer again soon- hint, hint moejuck and spector

750 ml bottle poured a translucent ruby red with a small lasting reddish amber head. Aromas of raspberry, yeast and cereal. Palate was light to medium bodied, crisp and tart. Flavors of tart raspberry and bread with a crisp lingering tart finish. One of the best fruit beers Ive drank!

750 ml bottle.  Pours a deep hazy ruby red color with a medium whitish pink, foamy head.  Sweet raspberry jam and puree aroma.  Taste is like drinking a freshly blended concoction of pure raspberries.  Pleasantly sweet  and bitter.  Excellent !!

Pours a deep hazy red, with a nice light pink head.  Smell is fresh raspberry jam.  Taste is much the same.  Very nice mouthfeel, fresh raspberrys, not too sweet, not too tart, nice malt character, very well balanced.  This is truly a great fruit beer.

Pours out a deep purple color with small thin lacing.  Aroma is oh so nice.  Smells just like a raspberry patch. MMMMMM.  Flavor is an intense raspberry flavor with a huge tart finish.  Im not to keen on sour or tart beers, but this one is the shit.

raspberries abound but are not obnoxious, a nice balance that finishes as well as it begins in your olfactory.  a deep rouge color with a pink head is one of the most unique and beautiful beers i have seen.

Picked up 750 ml bottle from brewery in New Glarus, Wisconsin. Pours a deep maroon brew with a purplish tan head. It laces pretty good. Aroma of ripe raspberries and dewberries. Taste of tart raspberries with doughnut bread and yeast. The finish is medium bodied. Very smooth and fruit is blended nicely with the malt. Tasty!
UPDATED: MAY 31, 2007 Another wonderful fruit expression from New Glarus. Beautiful raspberry/tart malt nose. The same on the palate. Great dessert beer.
Nice deep red color, with a tart raspberry aroma.  A perfect dessert beer, and one to be shared with everyone.

750 ml bottle:  Pours w/ a thin but lasting pink head and a garnet colored body.  Initial aroma is of raspberries (go figure), sweaty leather, light wisps of cat box, and a bit of bready malt.  As it warms the malt sort of takes over but still remains a bit sour in the aroma.  Raspberries still assertive, but not as strong.  Balanced to tart initially, but it is sweet/tart as it warms slightly.  Sweetness up front, tart at the finish and into the aftertaste.  Some earthy leathery flavors as well as a faint wheat malt.  Lightly acidic, mouthpuckering tartness at first which you can actually feel, but very smooth and medium bodied. Lighter medium carbonation rounds out the m/f.  Very nice beer for 4% ABV.  Great complexities from the fermentation and not over powering on the raspberries.

Bottle; Nose of raspberries, raspberries, and raspberry jam on toast; dark berry colored with a small off white head; Flavor of sweet raspberries wit a bit of tartness; seems as though I should pour it on toast and eat it!

Bottle shared thanks to CMUBEERMAN.  Pours clear dark ruby with a thin pink head.  Aroma is tart raspberry and flaky pie crust.  Flavor is tart raspberry, tangy, wheat.  This fruit beer has a nice body and is on the heavier side.  This would make a great dessert beer, yet its not too sweet.  Superior to Lindemans Framboise.

Pours a nice dark dirty ruby color.  Beautiful seedy rich rasberry nose.  Very nice and mellow.  Very nice and tart with a great Concentrated rasberry flavor with a great tart acidity that finishes awesome.
user_location: Farewell Minny; Hello Puyallup, Washington, USA

text: UPDATED: JUN 5, 2007 Tart raspberry nose on this red pour.  Carbonated tart raspberry flavor.  Another excellent new glarus pour

Bottle:  Raspberry takes over your senses as soon as the bottle is opened.  Strong aroma of the purest, thickest raspberry smell you can imagine.  Pours a deep red with a modest pink head.  The taste is pure raspberry fruitiness with a deep sweet and tartness.  Like a raspberry syrup for waffles.  Nice pucker sensation in the tail.  A great beer - Thanks IndianaRed for sharing.
11/05. Dark Red with a small reddish head. Very prominant sweet raspberry aroma. Excellent sweet/tart flavor. no noticeable alcohol. An excellent desert beer. My favorite New Glarus.

Not a big fan of raspberries, the reason I have not tried this before but felt it was now or never.  Not bad.  Strong raspberry aroma and flavor.  It is sweet but that is more from the inherent sweetness of raspberries as this is fairly tart, not in a true Belgian sense of lip puckering but noticable.  A very good beer but when I have a choice I will choose the Red over this.

very similar to their belgian red...just with raspberries instead of cherries. lovely red color with a pinkish head that doesnt last too long. sparkly mouthfeel with the flavor of tart raspberries...nice blend of the sweet and sour. thanks justincredible for the bottle.

Pours a murky, deep Raspberry red with a pinkish head. Fresh bouquet of Raspberries fills the air.  Tastes like freshly picked berries.  Sour and acidic woodiness, very sweet like jelly.  The tartness lingers.  A wonderful fruit beer!

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2012 Bottle courtesy of tjthresh.  Pours hazy and lightly cloudy ruby with a spare fizzy off-white head, mostly diminishing, spare lacing.  Aroma is heavy malt (bread), average hops (herbs, grass), average yeast (dough) with notes of cask and raspberry.  Medium bodied, oily texture, flat carbonation and a chalky finish.  Average duration, heavy sweetness (cloying), light acitiy and bitterness; syrupy.

750ml bottle, served in a flute glass as an offering to my lovely wife on Valentines day.  The pour is a deep red color, with minimal head.  An intense raspberry aroma is immediately evident, with no detectable brett or yeasty character. Mildy sour, and pleasantly tart, the raspberry flavor dominates, with a light sweetness that is balanced by the tartness.  The medium-bodied sweetness persists into the aftertaste, but is never sticky  or cloying.  As I drink further, the tartness to sweetness ratio changes, tipping to the side of pleasantly tart sourness.

750ml. poured a beautiful purple with thin pink head. an amazing looking beer. nose is gushing fresh raspberries. flavor is intense raspberries starting mildly tart and finishing sweet. mouthfeel is velvety smooth. a wonderfully sweet and tart raspberry delight. i like this better than bel. red but like it, i cant drink very much of this.

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2007 750ml.  cant say that im the biggest fan of fruit beer but this was a mighty fine offering by NG.  Poured a deep red with a thin pink head.  Aroma was, you guessed it, full of raspberries and the taste was very much of the same.  Sweet, tart, and goes down well.  Extremely drinkable.
750ml. Thanks to jdg0608. Poured a very dark deep red color with a purple haze. Aroma is very sweet. and full of raspberry. Taste is sweet at first with a nice sour to bitter finish.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2007 There are three things to keep in mind if you are reading this review.

1. I am normally not super fond of fruit beers in general. 2. I dont like raspberries. 3. I purchased this for my wife who loves the Belgian Red. That said, I thought this was not bad. Definitely tart raspberry aroma. Color is a violet/red with minimal head (similar to Belgian Red in that way). That is the main flavor as well. A dessert beer that I can appreciate, just not necessarily my cup of tea. Both my wife and I liked the Belgian Red slightly better, but thought this was pretty decent. Good to know if Im ever in Wisconsin, I can pick up a beer that she enjoys.

(Bottle) Pours a red color, with nice sparkling carbonation. Excellent aroma full of raspberry with a touch of vanilla. Very well balanced, not quite as sour as I expected. Amazing flavor that is much like something you would expect from the aroma. A very high quality beer overall.
